• Overview
  • Protocol Basics
  • Entities states
  • API Reference

InfiniBox Management API

Version 6.0.14

Overview

INFINIDAT InfiniAPI provides programmatic access to the InfiniBox storage system. Use the APIs to access the system components and entities, create and edit entities and perform storage operations.

Terminology

  • InfiniBox - The INFINIDAT storage system that is queried and posted to through the InfiniAPI.
  • Entity - A logical entity, representing a portion or component of the InfiniBox business logic. For example, pool, volume, host, etc.
  • Object - In REST terminology, the InfiniBox entity is an Object, a data structure with a known set of fields. The RESTful API request operates on, or returns the data of an object. For the data structure of an object – see the next section.
  • Collection - An array of entities that is requested by an API request, along with possible support for filtering, sorting, field selection, pagination, and other common functions. For example, all of the pools on an InfiniBox system, some of the pools of an InfiniBox system that meet a certain criteria. For the data structure of a collection – see the next section.

All the resources and methods mentioned here are public; that is, are available for the use by end-users.

Request headers

The client sends the InfiniBox a request with the following headers:

  • Content-Type: application/json

Protocol Basics

This section covers the structure of the supported requests, and their repsonses. We'll start from the response.

Data structure

The API uses the JSON protocol. The JSON protocol comprises the following data types:

  • Null - null (only one value)
  • Boolean - true or false
  • Number - Numeric values, e.g: 123456
  • String - Characters, enclosed in quotes, e.g: "some text"
  • Object - A JSON object is a container of fields and values. Objects may contain nested objects. For example: 
         {
      "age": 42,
      "name": "Joe",
      "is_married": true,
      "children_ids": [2, 5, 4],
      "job_id": null,
      "metadata": {
                   "religion": "PASTAFARIANISM",
                   "political_affiliation": null
                  }
     }

CRUD operations

The following HTTP methods create, read, update and delete InfiniBox objects and collections. For example:
Operation Syntax Body structure Response structure
Create an entity POST /collection Required The created entity
Read an entity GET /collection/<id> - The read entity
Read all entities GET /collection - A paginated list of entities
Update an entity PUT /collection/<id> Required The updated entity
Delete an entity DELETE /collection/<id> - The deleted entity

Storage operations other than CRUD

The following table sepcifies the details of some storage operations - other than CRUD - that are available in InfiniBox InfiniAPI.

Operation Syntax Body structure Response structure
Lock a pool POST api/rest/pools/{pool_id}/lock
Where pools is the name of the collection and pool_id is an object within this collection.		 - The entity, with a change to one of its fields: "state": "LOCKED"
Get a list of the pool's administrators POST api/rest/pools/{pool_id}/all_admins - A list of the pool's administrators.

Response to a request

Each response returns a JSON-encoded object in the HTTP body, which contains 3 attributes:

  • result - the actual data returned by the request. May be null in case of error, or if the data is not available yet.
  • metadata - additional information about the result, such as the pagination data and so on.
  • error - in case of an error, contains the error code and human-readable error message. Otherwise it is null.

Successful request

A response to a request that ended successfully contains the following:

  • The result part returns data (in this case: role, email and uid of two users).
  • The metadata returns details about the result:
    • ready means that the request ended successfully and a new request can be sent.
    • The other metadata provides details about the number of objects that were returned, and the way the result is paginated
  • The error part returns null, as the request ended successfully.
    • {
    "result": [
        {
            "role": "ADMIN",
            "email": "alice@example.com",
            "uid": "alicia"
        },
        {
            "role": "ADMIN",
            "email": "bob@example.com",
            "uid": "bob"
        }
    ],
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true,
        "number_of_objects": 2,
        "page_size": 50
        "pages_total": 1,
        "page": 1,
    },
    "error": null
}

    A request that ends with an error

    Here is a sample response from a request that ended with an error:

    • The result part returns null, as the request was not answered.
    • The metadata part returns the following details about the result:
      • ready means that the request ended successfully and a new request can be sent.
      • No information about returned objects, as no objects were returned.
    {
    "result": null,
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    },
    "error": {
        "message": "You must authenticate",
        "code": "AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED"
    },
}

    Authentication

    All API requests must be accompanied by an Authorization header containing a Base64-encoded username:password pair (HTTP basic authentication). Otherwise, an HTTP 401 error is returned.

    The only exception is the login request, which purpose is to check whether a given username and password pair is valid.

    The structure of the collection

    When requesting a collection of objects (for example, all volumes for a pool, or all volumes in the system), the result can span over hundreds of objects and thousands of lines. In order to enhance its readability, the following response attributes can be set as part of the GET request:

    • Pagination - how many objects are displayed on each page
    • Filter - which of the collection object will be displayed in the response
    • Sort - how the objects are sorted
    • Fields - which of the object fields is included in the response

    Pagination

    For ease of readability, the objects that the response returns are paginated. The default pagination is 50 objects per page.

    You can change the pagination by specifying two parameters:

    • page_size - The number of entities on each page.
    • page - The number of the page that is displayed on screen.

    Example 1: default pagination of GET api/rest/volumes

    GET request api/rest/volumes
    Response 
    {
    "result": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "name": "vol-01",
            ... ... ...
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "name": "vol-02",
            ... ... ...
        },
        ... ... ...
}
    Metadata 
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true,
        "page": 1,
        "number_of_objects": 15,
        "page_size": 50,
        "pages_total": 1
    }
    Page As there are 15 objects in the response, and the size of a page is 50 objects, there is only one page.
    Number of objects The number of objects in the collections. This number is not affected by the pagination.
    Page size 50 objects per page.

    Example 2: 3 volumes per page, displaying the second page

    GET request api/rest/volumes?page_size=3&page=2
    Response As there are 3 volumes per page, the 2nd page displays the 4th, 5th and 6th volumes. 
    {
    "result": [
        {
            "id": 4,
            "name": "vol-04",
            ... ... ...
        },
        {
            "id": 5,
            "name": "vol-05",
            ... ... ...
        },
        {
            "id": 6,
            "name": "vol-06",
            ... ... ...
        },
        ... ... ...
}
    Metadata 
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true,
        "page": 2,
        "number_of_objects": 15,
        "page_size": 3,
        "pages_total": 5
    }
    Page As requested, this response includes page 2.
    Number of objects The number of objects in the collections. This number is not affected by the pagination.
    Page size As requested, there are 3 objects per page.

    Filtering

    Some responses can be filtered, so that only specific objects will be returned. For such responses, you can filter the returned objects by stating a valid value to one of their attributes.

    You can filter the InfiniBox volumes by many of their attributes, for example their type (a Master, Snap, or Clone).

    Simple filtering example

    Setting a filter is done by specifying the filter argument (attribute and value). In the following example, only Master volumes are returned.

    api/rest/volumes?type=master

    If the field and values are set incorrectly, the following error messages are returned:

    • ATTRIBUTE_NOT_FOUND - The attributes could not be found. Resolve this error by making sure that the attribute indeed exists for this entity. For example, that the volume does have a type attribute.
    • MALFORMED_PARAMETER - The value of the attribute is illegal. Resolve this problem by making sure that the attribute you filter the response with, is legal. For example, that type accepts master.

    You can use the following operators in order to filter the response:

    Operator Acceptable value Examples
    eq number/string api/rest/volumes?pool_id=eq:134
    neq number/string api/rest/events?visibility=neq:customer
    is null To find all volumes that are not members of a consistency group (that is, whose cg_id value is null), use: api/rest/volumes?cg_id=is:null
    isnot null To find all volumes that are members of any consistency group (that is, whose cg_id value is not null), use:api/rest/volumes?cg_id=isnot:null
    lt number/string api/rest/events?timestamp=lt:2000000000000
    leq number/string api/rest/volumes?pool_id=leq:646
    gt number/string api/rest/volumes?pool_id=gt:646
    geq number/string api/rest/events?timestamp=geq:2000000000000
    in list Input list is val1, val2,.. which can be enclosed with () or [] or not enclosed at all.
    notin list Input list is val1, val2,.. which can be enclosed with () or [] or not enclosed at all.
    between list

    A list of exactly two items, e.g. [5,10]; the filter is inclusive, equivalent to x >= 5 AND y <= 10.
    like string

    Searches for a field containing the value (case-insensitive).

    "like:ny" on {MEENY, MINY, MOE, nyc} returns {MEENY, MINY, nyc}

    Notes:

    • When filtering on more than one field, the conditions are joined.
    • Unless otherwise stated, string comparisons are case insensitive.

    Sorting

    For most of the available collections, the objects can be sorted by one or more fields. The sorting is done according to order of the fields (from left to right). The syntax for sorting is as follows:

    api/rest/collection?sort=<field name>[,<field name>]

    The default sorting order is ascending. To specify a descending order, add a minus sign (-) before the field name. For example:

    /api/rest/events?sort=-level,timestamp

    The specific fields that can be used depend on the objects in question. Please refer to the documentation of each request for the list of valid fields.

    Choosing Which Fields to Get

    By default, requests that return objects will return all the fields of each object. If you are interested in only a few fields from the object, you can use the fields query parameter in order to "pluck" them from the objects and omit all other fields. This parameter should contain a comma-separated list of field names. For example:

    GET /api/rest/events?fields=id,uuid

    The response:

    {
    "error": null,
    "result": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "uuid": "a469575e-acd9-435f-bc5f-79ada0bc6add"
        },
        {
            "id": 2,
            "uuid": "326be807-6550-472a-9c68-b03f4b5171fa"
        },
        {
            "id": 3,
            "uuid": "799355fe-c529-4482-a2cc-ab672dffc6d5"
        },
        ...
    ],
    "metadata": {
    	...
    }
}

    The fields query parameter is supported by all API methods that are tagged as "pluckable".

    Note that passing a non-existent field name is not an error; it simply won't be returned for any object that doesn't have such a field.

    List of Metadata Keys

    Below is a list of all keys that can appear in the response metadata object.

    Key Presence Description
    ready always In most cases this will be true. If an asynchronous operation was requested, this will be false while the background operation is under way.
    result_url only when ready=false In case of an asynchronous operation whose results are not ready yet, this is the URL to poll for the results.
    page only for paginated lists The page that was requested.
    pages_total only for paginated lists The total number of pages in the list.
    page_size only for paginated lists The number of objects to return per page.
    number_of_objects only for paginated lists The total number of objects in the list.

    List of API Error Codes

    Successful GET request

    OK 200

    Successful post request

    Created 201 The response contains the created object.

    Request error

    UNKNOWN_PARAMETER 400 The request contains a parameter that is not part of the collection / object.
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER 400 The value of the parameter is invalid.
    MALFORMED_CONTENT 400 The request contains wrong content.
    MALFORMED_REQUEST 400 The request contains wrong headers.
    WRONG_PARAMETER 400 The request contains a parameter is not part of the collection / object.
    MISSING_QUERY_PARAMETER 400 A manadatory parameter is missing from the request.
    MISSING_FIELD 400 A manadatory parameter is missing from the request.
    MISSING_CONTENT 400 The request contains insufficient information for responding.
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD 400 The resource or service cannot accept a specified field or property
    MAX_PAGE_SIZE_VIOLATION 400 The requested page_size is too large (>1000)
    NOT_FOUND 404 Object not found.
    UNKNOWN_PATH 404 Requsted service does not exist.
    CONFLICT 409 The request conflicts with already existing collections (for example when trying to create an object that already exists).

    Approval required

    APPROVAL_REQUIRED 403 The operation requires a specific user-approval.

    Authentication erros

    AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED 401 The authentication headers are missing or invalid.
    UNAUTHORIZED 403 The user is not authorized to perform the requested action.

    Other erros

    RECONFIGURING HTTP 307 The system is currently reconfiguring, and cannot respond temporarily. Request should be retried in a few seconds.
    ILLEGAL_NODE_STATE HTTP 409 The requested node is not the master node.
    OPERATION_DENIED_CLUSTER_NOT_FULL HTTP 409 Cluster is not full or node in joining state.
    NOT_SUPPORTED_IN_SYSTEM_STATE HTTP 409 The request is not valid for the current system state.
    INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR HTTP 500 Internal server error.

    Refer to the documentation of specific API methods for information about additional error codes that they may return.

    Entities states

    This section covers the different entities states

    General physical states

    Below is a list of all possible physical states of all entities

    State Description
    OK The component state is OK
    MISSING The component is not seen by InfiniBox. The component might be physically missing (not installed) or failed in a way it is not recognized.
    WARNING A WARNING state means that an action needs to take place, however it is not urgent and there is no risk to the system availability. Examples: drive failure, FC port errors, drive medium errors, user login failure, etc.
    ERROR An ERROR state means that an immediate action is required in order to bring the system back to a fully functional state. Examples: node failure, port failure, Replication link disconnection, very low pool free space, etc.
    UNKNOWN The system cannot determine the state of the component, e.g. it can communicate with the component, but the response is not expected or not valid.

    Enclosure drive logical states

    Below is a list of all possible logical states of enclosure drives

    State Description
    ACTIVE Drive is active and part of the system
    FAILED Drive is marked as failed by the system
    MISSING Drive is missing or the system is unable to determine its state.
    PHASING_OUT Drive is in the process of gracefully retiring from a system
    READY Drive is ready to join the system (but is not yet part of the system)
    TESTING Drive is being tested
    UNKNOWN The system cannot determine the state of the component, e.g. it can communicate with the component, but the response is not expected or not valid.

    Nodes logical states

    Below is a list of all possible logical states of nodes

    State Description
    READY The node is ready to join the system (but is not yet part of the system).
    ACTIVE The node is active and part of the system.
    INACTIVE The node is not active.
    DEGRADED The node is partially active. One or more of its subsystems (Management, FC, etc.) is down.
    DEACTIVATING The node is in the process of gracefully retiring from a system. At the end of the deactivation, the node will be in the READY state. Note that the node will not be powered-off.
    ACTIVATING The node is in the process of joining a live system. At the end of the activation, the node will be in an ACTIVE state.

    API Reference

    Certificates

    Generate Csr

    Description Generate CSR
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/certificates/generate_csr
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "SANDNS": "liran", 
    "C": "IL", 
    "SANIP": "1.2.3.4"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----\nMIICujCCAaQCAQAwTjELMAkGA1UEBhMCSUwxJTAjBgNVBAMMHGlib3gwMTIubGFi\nLmlsLmluZmluaWRhdC5jb20xGDAWBgNVBAoMD0luZmluaWRhdCwgTHRkLjCCASIw\nDQYJKoZIhvcNAQEBBQADggEPADCCAQoCggEBAON7Ftq7sFQLTsarTmhaDJcawxtT\nzGqVzoTHj2uA5cvS/6gwyPqf7Qcs4NzJqKP3SjwEDHeR1pMRmdNuJlQ+wS5eSEVx\nesOg1pN/CWoPKwpONFuw878ANsOjTYBn1jWur8UDJhxjsGGjJSQnz8q2BwmqESSI\nq5uaXouWcn9W6bl8+Sxjcke8Xp8y/D5G2lX4QRf3hT4NM7we4npfT8BF6Gjzi2mZ\nPINesWKg/lZzHLPeW8qUjpHVYSYND0LiaQup0Kwdlpogwgw3nY9WdsgA3HxM4FQ7\npyGnjlOdNsk3oowrE6k26t9F5BNSpHlfzNANn+d0z8pUXhHS8NGBscvBLw8CAwEA\nAaApMCcGCSqGSIb3DQEJDjEaMBgwFgYDVR0RBA8wDYIFbGlyYW6HBAECAwQwCwYJ\nKoZIhvcNAQELA4IBAQAlmPxEt5eX8TU52cdSk8tqZSAcp1jNLtAJ329ksP3L5rqC\nFYAtNCTk7OBsPtPnrEmo2qGEFjk1IKvUUlNh8bMmUAVrYd9pUppMJ0mSePahiRZu\nAK0q7ByNt75h1A8bPmb6ygYU/cJhhfV2ELN7jIe5Z+AEoNjeU8FOHVRISmo80DK2\nznwJHsQt/g+edwwIqR7icgvB6DsDBfHMC3pColX5Di9SKfAP51B83BNtcQ60oquz\neGzpa0JrxdwDSJajoHAQzAyWJJox/qTDre5Uj5csliD1l7x2ha2gQr4YPVCZr8A9\n5IyHtMu+gSa77ycaQTFO9xdaPFpm5lpo1h3YtauQ\n-----END CERTIFICATE REQUEST-----\n", 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNKNOWN_PARAMETER HTTP 400 An unknown parameter was passed: 'UNKNWOWN_'
    INVALID_IP_ADDRESS HTTP 400 IP address '1.2.3' is invalid.
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges

    Generate Self Signed SSL Certificate

    Description Generate self-signed certificate
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Generating a self-signed certificate will reduce the system's security, and may cause scripts / GUI to become inaccessible (depending on your network policy)
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/certificates/generate_self_signed
    URL Parameters
    component SslCertificateComponentEnum Optional target component
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "public_key": {
            "raw": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8AMIIBCgKCAQEA03hHxBQ/rirICX8Lko9V\naMMrsSL48N9zhDqUbrzeaQ9Gpj3qn8cL/5dthgdLV+1IWGSniPuqsq9GVhqgeNsY\n7mXxFo91DXuPZKEW7ig68fj3Tg184h9n0HlWBmyIyz04TdakRSgFo7jy67Oqs6UX\nqAZQU9EOUdA9NF8A67e53lqmi7h6WIOzWoDjPip7YUzvR02S+FD5VgCa/ygPXIrf\npu96nJcTrK72ZsNwp5CDwl+JiQL7RnTH5blzxHDHBeklRraGWMnJtfjQbE5PKqRm\nvY6Bc8nse9qqUIFMSJc6wFwnllZ2xM7N47xm2VnAy8E++0YBlZ5sFiay1BfUuOvt\nwQIDAQAB\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----\n", 
            "modulus": "D37847C4143FAE2AC8097F0B928F5568C32BB122F8F0DF73843A946EBCDE690F46A63DEA9FC70BFF976D86074B57ED485864A788FBAAB2AF46561AA078DB18EE65F1168F750D7B8F64A116EE283AF1F8F74E0D7CE21F67D07956066C88CB3D384DD6A4452805A3B8F2EBB3AAB3A517A8065053D10E51D03D345F00EBB7B9DE5AA68BB87A5883B35A80E33E2A7B614CEF474D92F850F956009AFF280F5C8ADFA6EF7A9C9713ACAEF666C370A79083C25F898902FB4674C7E5B973C470C705E92546B68658C9C9B5F8D06C4E4F2AA466BD8E8173C9EC7BDAAA50814C48973AC05C27965676C4CECDE3BC66D959C0CBC13EFB4601959E6C1626B2D417D4B8EBEDC1", 
            "algorithm": "RSA"
        }, 
        "id": "httpd", 
        "certificate": {
            "issued_to": {
                "C": "US", 
                "CN": "ibox012.lab.il.infinidat.com", 
                "O": "Infinidat, Ltd."
            }, 
            "issued_on": 1639517017000, 
            "issued_by": {
                "C": "US", 
                "CN": "Infinilab", 
                "O": "Infinidat, Ltd."
            }, 
            "raw": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\nMIIDNjCCAiCgAwIBAgIGAX261FQuMAsGCSqGSIb3DQEBCzA7MQswCQYDVQQGEwJV\nUzESMBAGA1UEAwwJSW5maW5pbGFiMRgwFgYDVQQKDA9JbmZpbmlkYXQsIEx0ZC4w\nHhcNMjExMjE0MjEyMzM3WhcNMjYxMjE0MjEyMzM3WjBOMQswCQYDVQQGEwJVUzEl\nMCMGA1UEAwwcaWJveDAxMi5sYWIuaWwuaW5maW5pZGF0LmNvbTEYMBYGA1UECgwP\nSW5maW5pZGF0LCBMdGQuMIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8AMIIBCgKCAQEA\n03hHxBQ/rirICX8Lko9VaMMrsSL48N9zhDqUbrzeaQ9Gpj3qn8cL/5dthgdLV+1I\nWGSniPuqsq9GVhqgeNsY7mXxFo91DXuPZKEW7ig68fj3Tg184h9n0HlWBmyIyz04\nTdakRSgFo7jy67Oqs6UXqAZQU9EOUdA9NF8A67e53lqmi7h6WIOzWoDjPip7YUzv\nR02S+FD5VgCa/ygPXIrfpu96nJcTrK72ZsNwp5CDwl+JiQL7RnTH5blzxHDHBekl\nRraGWMnJtfjQbE5PKqRmvY6Bc8nse9qqUIFMSJc6wFwnllZ2xM7N47xm2VnAy8E+\n+0YBlZ5sFiay1BfUuOvtwQIDAQABozEwLzAtBgNVHREEJjAkghxpYm94MDEyLmxh\nYi5pbC5pbmZpbmlkYXQuY29thwSsEQABMAsGCSqGSIb3DQEBCwOCAQEAWas6civZ\nUp2YlFQ+pJj2AWKQ2ihkmPY+VaWdyiIw/5m1psfWVAvtI6jOcE1Ucgbeh56izY2d\n+vujSFPKL7uRVRq06iDAkdDQ/7L+NkTXu58WY6lxP8VtBTE+sOV0HsTsKhYAOyPd\nxfRSc5CqYLtt5QSnAsyn8rYbjiPcpWWcdA6ySvtAQT+xAwxDChgwPLXZX8rYnjyp\nLSUcOoyhkStSsOWP5AIAUUzRqKkN04iPntuXkSDFhrzDlBMa4wdGE5wOdiaGctL3\n5YJfYNa/f+/bWRXTJlcZMm1wQgTObufZwlorPMEtyiXzUAM/HZhXoAvcn4/xiSxC\ngGZzhuKtsBAnJw==\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n", 
            "version": 3, 
            "signature_algorithm": "SHA256WITHRSA", 
            "serial_number": "17DBAD4542E", 
            "expired": false, 
            "expires_on": 1797283417000
        }
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Generating a self-signed certificate will reduce the system's security, and may cause scripts / GUI to become inaccessible (depending on your network policy)
    CERTIFICATE_INVALID HTTP 409 The certificate provided is not valid. Reason: General error occurred

    Get SSL Certificate Info

    Description Get current certificates info
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/system/certificates
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 1, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "public_key": {
                "raw": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\nMIIBIjANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQEFAAOCAQ8AMIIBCgKCAQEAvF35A8X3CNftIGZYx+HX\n2WH52q6j/hdMh5+Uhzj31YzREwBoVTd7PUmq4dzVurnFIBYGLwRz5Iyxve7QwwK/\ny1NNiyzS+wjObctIJjkeeHn9XeGGEKEsGmf1bP8YoJ1DhJB2HVMsz3gjqRFEo4bm\nXHfEoY8MC+kbtcYPgS1M6umOtAMXTfNc7ewA91t8YFfy+GFcQkukwb/tIHQ7FXKm\nQxQd7E1fvb34e3vmlRmi2UhRHxh3rC2j56P6OWj84X44+R5v4Y4ki+m2aZw405Gg\nRVj0xdjx2TGJIURU6uvBJA0MTQEDD851TH2FK4lUv1vZYisIWDuEeCZI8nndhUpX\nowIDAQAB\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----\n",

    Upload Csr

    Description Upload CSR-signed certificate
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/certificates/upload_csr
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    "--Boundary_4_1464839439_1639517022744\r\nContent-Type: application/octet-stream\r\nContent-Disposition: form-data; filename=\"upload\"; name=\"upload\"\r\n\r\n----BEGIN GARBAGE----\r\n--Boundary_4_1464839439_1639517022744--\r\n"

    Errors
    MALFORMED_CERTIFICATE HTTP 400 The certificate provided is malformed or in unsupported format
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    CERTIFICATE_INVALID HTTP 409 The certificate provided is not valid. Reason: General error occurred
    CSR_MISMATCH HTTP 409 The certificate provided does not match the certificate request generated previously

    Upload SSL Certificate and Key

    Description Upload certificate + key
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/certificates
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL

    MALFORMED_CERTIFICATE HTTP 400 The certificate provided is malformed or in unsupported format
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges

    Components

    This collection resource holds all physical and software components in the system that cannot be dynamically created or deleted. The API provides indication of the health status of each component, and a list of alerts on each component that affects its status.

    Get the InfiniBox Components

    Description Get information about the rack and its components.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/components/
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN,  POOL_ADMIN,  READ_ONLY,  ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "enclosures_number": 8, 
        "patch_panels": [], 
        "enclosures": [
            {
                "state_description": "", 
                "vendor": "NEWISYS", 
                "last_probe_timestamp": 1390254009000, 
                "firmware": "0509", 
                "drives": [
                    {
                        "state_description": "", 
                        "drive_index": 1, 
                        "vendor": "SEAGATE ", 
                        "product_id": "", 
                        "encryption_state": null, 
                        "enclosure_index": 1, 
                        "firmware": "n/a", 
                        "hw": {
                            "pending_reallocations": 10, 
                            "state": "OK", 
                            "reallocations": 10, 
                            "temperature": 10, 
                            "power_on_hours": 10
                        }, 
                        "probe_ttl": 86400000, 
                        "failure_reason": "unknown", 
                        "state": "ACTIVE", 
                        "product_rev": "", 
                        "bytes_capacity": 0,

    Config

    Get all Parameters

    Description Return all system parameters including management, core, ip configuration and limits
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/config/
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns

    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    },

    Get Parameter

    Description Return the specific system parameter
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/config/{category}/{key}
    URL Parameters
    category String
    key String
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": false, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Parameter not found

    Get TreeQ Hard Reached Interval

    Description Gets treeQ hard reach interval
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/config/mgmt/file.treeq_hard_reached_interval_minutes
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": 90, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors See general list of error codes.

    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (999999999) of parameter 'pools.minimum_size' does not meet a condition: 'greater than or equal to 1000000000'
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    INVALID_SERVER_NAME HTTP 400 Server name '-localhost' is invalid
    INVALID_PARAMETER_LENGTH HTTP 400 Parameter ('value') length must be between 0 and 255 characters. Actual: 256
    INVALID_IP_ADDRESS HTTP 400 IP address 'a ' is invalid. DNS IP address is not valid
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    PARAMETER_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Parameter not found
    ILLEGAL_LOGGER_LEVEL HTTP 409 Illegal logger level: INFOO. Allowed levels: [TRACE, ALL, ERROR, STARTUP, INFO, FATAL, DEBUG, OFF, WARN]
    READONLY_PARAMETER HTTP 409 Parameter is read-only
    CONFIG_PARAM_UPDATE_FAILED HTTP 409 Update config param failed. Reason: OpenVMS capabilities are disabled
    AUTO_UDID_RANGE_ILLEGAL HTTP 409 The specifed UDID range is not valid

    Consistency Group

    Add Member

    Description Add a dataset to a consistency group
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/cgs/{id}/members
    URL Parameters
    id long The ID of the consistency group
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "dataset_id": 1001, 
    "replication_pair_info": null
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "is_replicated": false, 
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--72a11d8a-eaa4-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 1, 
        "name": "cg1", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516173715, 
        "updated_at": 1639516173917, 
        "pool_id": 1000, 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "NONE"
        ], 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1006
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('replication_pair_info')
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('active_active_info') is missing in an object passed
    REPLICA_PAIR_ALREADY_EXISTING HTTP 409 When adding a replicated entity to a replicated consistency group, no entity pair may be supplied in the command
    GROUP_MEMBERS_LIMIT_EXCEEDED HTTP 409 A consistency group cannot have more than 10 members.
    ILLEGAL_CG_DATASET_TYPE HTTP 409 A filesystem cannot be added to a consistency group
    CG_MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_ADDED_TO_SYNC_REPLICA HTTP 409 Cannot add a member to a replicated consistency group whose replication type is SYNC. Change the replication type to ASYNC, add the member and then change the replication type back to SYNC
    REPLICA_PARTIAL_FAILURE HTTP 409 Replica add member failed, replica status is unknown. User intervention is required. FM service: core, command rc: FAIL, error_string: null, error_code: FM_DUMMY_CODE, error_description:
    TARGET_DATASET_IS_REPLICATED HTTP 409 Replicated target datasets cannot be added to a consistency group: vol_ea4fe203-0a03-40c9-bcf7-55c5c2709acd_replica
    REPLICATED_DATASETS_LIMIT HTTP 409 The system has reached the maximum number of replicated datasets
    CG_MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_ADDED_TO_ACTIVE_AA_REPLICA HTTP 409 Cannot add a member 'auto-volume--a286c24f-e2f0' to an active active-active replica. Suspend the replica before adding the member
    DATASET_NOT_IN_CG_POOL HTTP 409 The dataset is not in the same pool as the consistency group
    MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_ADDED_TO_SG HTTP 409 A snapshot group member cannot be added
    REPLICATED_MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_ADDED_TO_AA_REPLICA HTTP 409 Cannot add a replicated member 'auto-volume--4a6d9c55-f974' to an active-active replica. Delete the member's replica before adding to the consistency group
    CG_MEMBER_TYPE_MISMATCH HTTP 409 The synchronization types of the member and the consistency group have to be identical. In addition, a member can be added only to a replicated consistency group whose type is ASYNC
    REPLICA_IS_RESERVED_FOR_INFINISAFE HTTP 409 Replica is reserved for infinisafe, moving the member is not allowed
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Adding a member to a CG concurrent replica is not supported
    ACTIVE_ACTIVE_PEER_CANNOT_BE_ADDED_TO_CG HTTP 409 Cannot add an active-active peer volume to a consistency group
    DATASET_ALREADY_IN_A_CG HTTP 409 The dataset is already a part of a consistency group
    ILLEGAL_CG_DATASET HTTP 409 Snapshots cannot be added to consistency groups.
    CG_ADD_MEMBER_BASE_SNAPSHOT_NOT_FOUND HTTP 409 Can't find base snapshot for the new member of the consistency group
    SOURCE_DATASET_IS_REPLICATED HTTP 409 Replicated source datasets cannot be added to a non-replicated consistency group: auto-volume--14e72d52-91eb

    Create Consistency Group

    Description Creates a consistency group or a snapshot group
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    The active-active replica of entity_name is lagging and the snapshot will reflect the latest consistent data replicated. To get up-to-date data in the snapshot we advise to take the snapshot on the remote system
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/cgs
    URL Parameters none
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "name": "cg1", 
    "pool_id": 1000
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "is_replicated": false, 
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--72a11d8a-eaa4-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 0, 
        "name": "cg1", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516173715, 
        "updated_at": 1639516173715, 
        "pool_id": 1000, 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "NONE"
        ], 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1006
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    SG_MEMBER_INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Snapshot group member generated name, which is a combination of the member's name with the prefix is too long. Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('snap_prefix' or 'snap_suffix') is missing in an object passed
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value ( ) of parameter 'snap_prefix' does not meet a condition: 'must include valid name characters only'
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('pool_id')
    INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 The active-active replica of fred_1639516392672_1639516392760_auto-Replica--1c3456ed-1c3 is lagging and the snapshot will reflect the latest consistent data replicated. To get up-to-date data in the snapshot we advise to take the snapshot on the remote system
    POOL_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Pool not found
    REPLICA_INCONSISTENT_DATASETS HTTP 409 Taking a snapshot cannot be completed because at least one dataset has not reached a consistent state
    REPLICA_ALREADY_RECLAIMED HTTP 409 The entity requested is a replication staging area and has already been reclaimed with name svol_a86b98bc-0b0d-4343-8afd-6e3b803f6475_replica_
    SG_SNAP_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 Cannot take a snapshot of a snapshot group
    CG_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 An entity with this name already exists
    ILLEGAL_POOL_TYPE_FOR_CG HTTP 409 A CG cannot be created within a vVol pool
    VOLUME_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 An entity with this name already exists
    INVALID_LOCK_DURATION HTTP 409 Lock expiry cannot exceed 365 days
    CG_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 Consistency group count limit reached
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Please try to suspend the replica again, creating a snapshot group from an Active Active replica which is not consistent is not supported
    CG_SNAP_WITH_NO_MEMBERS HTTP 409 Cannot take a snapshot of an empty consistency group
    INVALID_LOCK_EXPIRY HTTP 409 Lock expiry date has to be in the future
    SG_CG_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 A new snapshot group cannot be created. The consistency group has reached the maximum number of snapshot groups
    INVALID_LOCK_ENTITY_TYPE HTTP 409 Locking MASTER is not allowed
    DATASET_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 The request exceeds the dataset count limit

    Delete Consistency Group

    Description Disband a single consistency group
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Deleting the type group will break the consistency of its members. In case the delete_members parameters is set to yes, the type group members are deleted.
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/cgs/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long The id of the consistency group to delete
    delete_members boolean Select whether to delete the group's datasets as well
    force_if_snapshot_locked boolean force_if_snapshot_locked
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--951ae7e2-84f0-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 1, 
        "name": "auto-cg_-c51130bf-7d9f-490", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516307477, 
        "updated_at": 1639516307806, 
        "pool_id": 1000, 
        "is_replicated": false, 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "NONE"
        ], 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1026
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Deleting the consistency group will break the consistency of its members. In case the delete_members parameters is set to yes, the consistency group members are deleted.
    REPLICATED_CG_CANNOT_BE_DELETED HTTP 409 A replicated consistency group cannot be deleted. Remove the replication, then delete the consistency group
    DELETE_SNAPSHOT_WITH_LOCKED_DESCENDANTS HTTP 409 Snapshot 'auto-snap--852d4637-d6e5-4' has locked descendants, and can only be deleted after they expire, on: '2021-12-19 23:18:59' UTC
    VOLUME_IS_MAPPED HTTP 409 The volume cannot be deleted. Volume 'vol1' has active mappings
    DELETE_LOCKED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 Snapshot group 'snapshot' is locked, and can only be deleted after '2021-12-19 23:18:44' UTC
    SG_CG_DELETE_LIMIT HTTP 409 The consistency group cannot be deleted: it contains more than the maximum number of snapshot groups allowed for a delete operation

    Move to Pool

    Description Move a consistency group to other pool, along with its related datasets
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/cgs/{id}/move
    URL Parameters
    id long The ID of the consistency group to move
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "pool_id": 1000, 
    "with_capacity": false
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--08072554-2639-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 5, 
        "name": "auto-cg_-a6e6d4ff-c9fc-40b", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516633686, 
        "updated_at": 1639516634532, 
        "pool_id": 1000, 
        "is_replicated": true, 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "ASYNC_SOURCE"
        ], 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1004
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    ILLEGAL_MOVE_TO_VVOL_POOL HTTP 409 Cannot move Consistency Group auto-cg_-d5df85cc-6c8f-4c2 into vVol pool test-vvol-move-pool, because test-vvol-move-pool is dedicated for VMware vVols
    SG_CANNOT_BE_MOVED HTTP 409 a snapshot group can be moved only as part of a consistency group move
    INSUFFICIENT_POOL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 The pool has insufficient capacity. Reason: The capacity of the target pool is insufficient for this action. Pool free capacity is: 1TB, required capacity is: 10TB

    Refreshing a Snapshot Group

    Description Refreshes a snapshot group from a parent
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Refreshing entity 'dataset_name' will overwrite its cg_membersdata
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/cgs/{id}/refresh
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the target snapshot group
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "source_id": 1004
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--e7108f1b-a20d-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 3, 
        "name": "auto-sg_-fedceef8-c114-425", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516380560, 
        "updated_at": 1639516380746, 
        "pool_id": 1001, 
        "is_replicated": false, 
        "parent_id": 1004, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "NONE"
        ], 
        "type": "SNAPSHOT", 
        "id": 1014
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Refreshing snapshot group 'auto-sg_-f1b72a0b-537a-48c' will overwrite its members data
    SG_REFRESH_NOT_SG HTTP 409 The specified entity is not a snapshot group
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Please try to suspend the replica again, refreshing a snapshot from an Active Active replica which is not consistent is not supported
    INVALID_OPERATION_ON_LOCKED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 This operation is not allowed on a locked snapshot group until its lock expires
    SG_REFRESH_NOT_DIRECT_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 The specified snapshot group is not a child of the specified consistency group
    SG_REFRESH_INCONSISTENT_MEMBERS_NUMBER HTTP 409 The number of snapshots in the snapshot group is inconsistent with the number of members in the consistency group

    Remove Member

    Description Remove a dataset from a consistency group, along with its snapshots
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Deleting a replica will stop replicating the dataset(s)
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/cgs/{id}/members/{dataset_id}
    URL Parameters
    id long The ID of the consistency group
    dataset_id long The ID of the dataset to remove
    retain_staging_area Boolean Retention of staging areas
    create_replica Boolean Create a replica
    replica_name String Name for the new replica
    force_if_no_remote_credentials Boolean Allow this operation even if a login error is returned by the remote system
    force_if_remote_error Boolean Allow this operation even if an error is returned by the remote system
    force_on_target Boolean Allow one-sided operation on the target
    force_on_local Boolean Allow one-sided operation
    keep_serial_on_local Boolean Allows keeping or resetting the external identification data of the local replica volume/s
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "is_replicated": true, 
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--612fb65d-fc69-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 1, 
        "name": "auto-cg_-bbdf7ecc-ebc0-425", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516304516, 
        "updated_at": 1639516304898, 
        "pool_id": 1002, 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "ASYNC_SOURCE"
        ], 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1003
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('create_replica')
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Deleting a replica will stop replicating the dataset(s)
    CG_DATASET_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Dataset is not a member of the consistency group
    LINK_IO_ERROR HTTP 409 I/O error when trying to communicate with remote system '{host}'
    REPLICA_CANNOT_CREATE_IF_FORCE HTTP 409 Replica creation cannot be specified with force on target or force on remote error
    DATASET_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 The request exceeds the dataset count limit
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Removing a member from a CG concurrent replica is not supported
    REPLICA_PARTIAL_FAILURE HTTP 409 Replica removing a member failed, replica status is unknown. User intervention is required.
    REMOVE_MEMBER_AA_REPLICA_FROM_LAGGING_SIDE HTTP 409 Cannot remove a member auto-volume--90090afd-7998 of consistency group in an active-active replica from the lagging side
    CG_MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_REMOVED_FROM_SYNC_REPLICA HTTP 409 Cannot remove a member from a replicated consistency group whose replication type is SYNC. Change the replication type to ASYNC, remove the member and then change the replication type back to SYNC
    REPLICA_INVALID_CONFIGURATION HTTP 409 The local configuration does not match the remote one. Please resume replica first
    CG_MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_REMOVED_FROM_ACTIVE_AA_REPLICA HTTP 409 Cannot remove a member 'auto-volume--65d19c7b-618c' from an active active-active replica. Suspend the replica before removing the member
    AA_REMOVE_MEMBER_NOT_POSSIBLE HTTP 409 Cannot remove a member of an active-active replica when it is mapped because the serial ID will be changed. Please remove all member mappings
    REPLICA_REMOVE_MEMBER_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_TARGET HTTP 409 Removing a member on the target system is not allowed unless the link to the source is down and the operation is acknowledged by the user
    REPLICA_IS_RESERVED_FOR_INFINISAFE HTTP 409 Replica is reserved for infinisafe, removing a member is not allowed
    MEMBER_CANNOT_BE_REMOVED_FROM_SG HTTP 409 A snapshot group member cannot be removed

    Restoring a Consistency Group

    Description Restore a consistency group from a snapshot group
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Restoring a consistency group 'cg_name' that has datasets added after taking a snapshot group will restore only the snapshotted datasets. The datasets that were added to the consistency group after the snapshot group was taken, will not be restored
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/cgs/{id}/restore
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the target consistency group
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    "1016"
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": true, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Restoring a consistency group 'auto-cg_-5cd7f257-dd84-413' that has datasets added after taking a snapshot group will restore only the snapshotted datasets. The datasets that were added to the consistency group after the snapshot group was taken, will not be restored
    PROTECTED_DATASET_CANNOT_BE_RESTORED HTTP 409 A dataset (vol_wp) that is write-protected cannot be restored
    ILLEGAL_CG_RESTORE_REQUEST HTTP 409 Consistency group can only be restored from one of its snapshot groups
    REPLICATED_CG_RESTORE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 A replicated consistency group cannot be restored

    Update Consistency Group

    Description Update consistency group attributes with input map data
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Unlocking a datasetType should only be done after the customer signs a release form
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/cgs/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long The ID of the CG to update
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "name": "newCgName"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--f5e3f2b2-abf7-4", 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "members_count": 3, 
        "name": "newCgName", 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516638250, 
        "updated_at": 1639516639167, 
        "pool_id": 1002, 
        "is_replicated": true, 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_state": "UNLOCKED", 
        "replication_types": [
            "ASYNC_SOURCE"
        ], 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1003
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('parent_id')
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Unlocking a snapshot group should only be done after the customer signs a release form
    UNLOCK_FORBIDDEN HTTP 409 Snapshot group 'snapshot' is locked until '2021-12-19 23:20:43' UTC, the lock cannot be removed
    INVALID_LOCK_EXPIRY HTTP 409 Lock expiry date has to be in the future
    INVALID_LOCK_ENTITY_TYPE HTTP 409 Locking consistency group is not allowed
    SNAPSHOT_LOCK_FORBIDDEN HTTP 409 Snapshot 'vols' cannot be further locked as it is write-enabled
    LOCK_EXPIRY_TOO_SHORT HTTP 409 The lock expiry of snapshot group 'snapshot' cannot be lowered. Current expiry time is '2021-12-19 23:22:37' UTC

            "pending_reallocations": 10, 
            "state": "OK", 
            "reallocations": 10, 
            "temperature": 10, 
            "power_on_hours": 10
        }, 
        "probe_ttl": 86400000, 
        "failure_reason": "REASON NONE", 
        "state": "ACTIVE", 
        "product_rev": "", 
        "bytes_capacity": 0, 
        "serial_number": "serial1", 
        "model": "model1", 
        "last_probe_timestamp": 1390251656000, 
        "nodes_access": [
            false, 
            false, 
            false
        ], 
        "id": 1
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MALFORMED_ID_TYPE HTTP 404 Object Not Found. Invalid drive_index type (expect to get Number)
    DRIVE_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Drive not found

    Phase In Drive

    Description Phase in drive by id
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/components/racks/{rackId}/enclosures/{enclosure_index}/drives/{drive_index}/phase_in
    URL Parameters
    drive_index int The drive id
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ACTIVE, STANDBY
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "drive_index": 1, 
        "serial_no": "", 
        "product_id": "", 
        "drive_health": null, 
        "vendor_id": "", 
        "path_on": [], 
        "encryption_state": null, 
        "state": "ACTIVE", 
        "product_rev": "", 
        "bytes_capacity": 0, 
        "enclosure_index": 1
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    DRIVE_SIZE_TOO_SMALL HTTP 409 The drive cannot be activated because the drive size is smaller than the minimum size set for the system
    DRIVE_TYPE_MISMATCH HTTP 409 The drive cannot be activated because it does not match the system configuration
    RETRY_DRIVE_IN_METADATA_SAVE HTTP 409 The drive cannot be activated or deactivated at this time because it is saving metadata

    Phase Out Drive

    Description Phase out drive by id
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/components/racks/{rackId}/enclosures/{enclosure_index}/drives/{drive_index}/phase_out
    URL Parameters
    drive_index int The drive id
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ACTIVE, STANDBY
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "drive_index": 1, 
        "serial_no": "", 
        "product_id": "", 
        "drive_health": null, 
        "vendor_id": "", 
        "path_on": [], 
        "encryption_state": null, 
        "state": "ACTIVE", 
        "product_rev": "", 
        "bytes_capacity": 0, 
        "enclosure_index": 1
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MULTIPLE_DRIVE_MISSING HTTP 409 Drive deactivation failed due to multiple drive loss
    RETRY_DATA_REDISTRIBUTION HTTP 409 The drive cannot be deactivated at this time because the system is undergoing redistribution
    RETRY_DRIVE_IN_METADATA_SAVE HTTP 409 The drive cannot be activated or deactivated at this time because it is saving metadata
    RETRY_RAIDGROUP_IN_RECOVERY HTTP 409 The drive cannot be deactivated at this time because it has a temporary error
    RETRY_RAIDGROUP_IN_REBUILD HTTP 409 The drive cannot be deactivated at this time because it is needed for a rebuild
    NOT_SUPPORTED_IN_SYSTEM_STATE HTTP 409 Operation is not supported in system state N/A

    Returns
    Errors See general list of error codes.

    Get Switch by ID

    Description Return ethernet switch by index
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/components/racks/{rackId}/eth_switches/{swIdx}
    URL Parameters
    swIdx int The switch id
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN,  POOL_ADMIN,  READ_ONLY,  ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "state_description": "", 
        "vendor": "NETGEAR", 
        "last_probe_timestamp": 1412508793000, 
        "firmware": "n/a", 
        "probe_ttl": 60000, 
        "state": "ERROR", 
        "model": "GS116E", 
        "id": 1
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors See general list of error codes.

    Event

    The Events API provides access to the events generated in the system, and defines rules that control which events are sent by mail.

    An Event object looks like this: 

    {
    "timestamp": 1351623383906,
    "uuid": "97eb9c8c-bae0-4a82-96cb-6f9e9799eb29",
    "reporter": "MGMT",
    "id": 2517,
    "level": "INFO",
    "visibility": "CUSTOMER",
    "source_node_id": 1,
    "description": "Created snapshot 'volume_1a' id '590' from parent 'volume_1',
    "data": [
        {
          "name": "parent_id",
          "type": "VolumeID",
          "value": "102"
        },
        {
          "name": "parent_name",
          "type": "VolumeName",
          "value": "volume_1"
        },
        {
          "name": "vol_name",
          "type": "VolumeName",
          "value": "volume_1a"
        },
        {
          "name": "vol_id",
          "type": "VolumeID",
          "value": "590"
        }
    ],
    "code": "SNAP_CREATE",
    "description_template": "Created snapshot '{vol_name}' id '{vol_id}' from parent '{parent_name}' id '{parent_id}'",
    "system_version": "(TBD-unknown)"
}

    Create a Custom Event

    Description Create a custom event
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/events/custom
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL

    Invalid Operation States
    System StatesMethods
    LOCAL SHUTDOWN EMERGENCY_SHUTDOWN ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "description_template": "Some description with bad placeholder {specialCharacters)", 
    "data": null, 
    "visibility": "CUSTOMER", 
    "level": "INFO"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "affected_entity_id": 0, 
        "username": "infinidat", 
        "code": "CUSTOM_INFO_EVENT", 
        "description": "Some description", 
        "timestamp": 1639516388852, 
        "level": "INFO", 
        "seq_num": 56, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "reporter": "CUSTOM", 
        "visibility": "CUSTOMER", 
        "system_version": "6.0.14.0-dev", 
        "source_node_id": 1, 
        "description_template": "Some description", 
        "data": [
            {
                "type": "int", 
                "name": "one", 
                "value": "1"
            }, 
            {
                "type": "string", 
                "name": "two", 
                "value": "abc"
            }
        ], 
        "id": 56
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('level') is missing in an object passed
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (Some description with bad placeholder {specialCharacters)) of parameter 'description_template' does not meet a condition: 'field contains illegal placeholder '{dataParam}' format'
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('something')
    ILLEGAL_EVENT_DATA HTTP 400 Illegal event data: (type) is missing or specified as 'null'
    ILLEGAL_EVENT_LEVEL HTTP 409 Illegal event level: DUMMY_FIRST. Allowed values: INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL

    Create External Event

    Description Create external event
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/events
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL

    Invalid Operation States
    System StatesMethods
    LOCAL SHUTDOWN EMERGENCY_SHUTDOWN ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "code": "INFINIMETRICS_HEARTBEAT"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "affected_entity_id": 0, 
        "username": "auto-ADMIN-fbb68f0c-4156-4", 
        "code": "INFINIMETRICS_HEARTBEAT", 
        "description": "INFINIMETRICS_HEARTBEAT", 
        "timestamp": 1639516731242, 
        "level": "INFO", 
        "seq_num": 2642, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "reporter": "EXTERNAL", 
        "visibility": "INFINIDAT", 
        "system_version": "6.0.14.0-dev", 
        "source_node_id": 1, 
        "description_template": "INFINIMETRICS_HEARTBEAT", 
        "data": [], 
        "id": 2642
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('description')
    UNSUPPORTED_VALUE HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported value (null) for field ('data')
    EVENT_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Event not found

    Delete Events

    Description Deletes events older than a given timestamp
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/events
    URL Parameters
    filter RestFilter Timestamp of the event
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": null, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    RELATION_NOT_SUPPORTED_FOR_FIELD HTTP 400 Relation 'EQ' is not supported for field 'timestamp'
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('[(id LE 1607980735319)]') could not be translated to an expected type
    CANNOT_SET_EVENTS_RETENTION_TIME HTTP 409 Cannot delete events that occurred after 2020-12-14 23:18:56

    Get a Filtered List of Events

    Description Get a sorted and filtered list of events.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/events
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 2, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "affected_entity_id": 1000, 
            "username": "infinidat", 
            "code": "POOL_CREATED", 
            "description": "Created pool 'auto-pool--f60b0d40-cd3c-4' physical capacity: 1TB virtual capacity: 1TB emergency buffer: unlimited", 
            "timestamp": 1639516299804, 
            "level": "INFO", 
            "seq_num": 197, 
            "tenant_id": 1, 
            "reporter": "MGMT", 
            "visibility": "CUSTOMER", 
            "system_version": "6.0.14.0-dev", 
            "source_node_id": 1, 
            "description_template": "Created pool '{pool_name}' physical capacity: {physical_capacity} virtual capacity: {virtual_capacity} emergency buffer: {max_extend}", 
            "data": [
                {
                    "type": "PoolName", 
                    "name": "pool_name", 
                    "value": "auto-pool--f60b0d40-cd3c-4"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "Capacity", 
                    "name": "virtual_capacity", 
                    "value": "1TB"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "PoolID", 
                    "name": "pool_id", 
                    "value": "1000"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "Capacity", 
                    "name": "physical_capacity", 
                    "value": "1TB"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "String", 
                    "name": "max_extend", 
                    "value": "unlimited"
                }
            ], 
            "id": 197
        }, 
        {
            "affected_entity_id": 1001, 
            "username": "infinidat", 
            "code": "VOLUME_CREATED", 
            "description": "Created THIN volume 'auto-{Volume}-67f8b85a-163' in pool 'auto-pool--f60b0d40-cd3c-4' with a volume size: 1GB compression: true.", 
            "timestamp": 1639516299837, 
            "level": "INFO", 
            "seq_num": 198, 
            "tenant_id": 1, 
            "reporter": "MGMT", 
            "visibility": "CUSTOMER", 
            "system_version": "6.0.14.0-dev", 
            "source_node_id": 1, 
            "description_template": "Created {prov_type} volume '{volume_name}' in pool '{pool_name}' with a volume size: {size_in} compression: {compression}.", 
            "data": [
                {
                    "type": "PoolName", 
                    "name": "pool_name", 
                    "value": "auto-pool--f60b0d40-cd3c-4"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "Capacity", 
                    "name": "size_in", 
                    "value": "1GB"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "ProvType", 
                    "name": "prov_type", 
                    "value": "THIN"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "uint64", 
                    "name": "size", 
                    "value": "1000000000"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "PoolID", 
                    "name": "pool_id", 
                    "value": "1000"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "VolumeName", 
                    "name": "volume_name", 
                    "value": "auto-{Volume}-67f8b85a-163"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "VolumeID", 
                    "name": "volume_id", 
                    "value": "1001"
                }, 
                {
                    "type": "Bool", 
                    "name": "compression", 
                    "value": "true"
                }
            ], 
            "id": 198
        }
    ], 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MAX_PAGE_SIZE_VIOLATION HTTP 400 Requested page size 1001 exceeds range 1..1000 for command 'GetAllEventsFiltered'
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (-10) of parameter 'page_size' does not meet a condition: 'int >= 1'
    ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED_FOR_ROLE HTTP 403 User with role [ADMIN] is not allowed to perform this action

    Export

    Create an Export

    Description Create a new export.
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/exports
    URL Parameters none
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "inner_path": "/", 
    "pref_write": 16384, 
    "pref_read": 16384, 
    "max_read": 32768, 
    "pref_readdir": 16384, 
    "transport_protocols": "TCP", 
    "filesystem_id": 1001, 
    "max_write": 32768, 
    "privileged_port": true, 
    "export_path": "/vol/vol1/"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pref_readdir": 16384, 
        "updated_at": 1639516098997, 
        "id": 16, 
        "pref_write": 16384, 
        "anonymous_uid": 65534, 
        "max_write": 32768, 
        "export_path": "/vol/vol1/", 
        "32bit_file_id": false, 
        "snapdir_visible": true, 
        "make_all_users_anonymous": false, 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "permissions": [
            {
                "access": "RW", 
                "no_root_squash": true, 
                "client": "*"
            }
        ], 
        "inner_path": "/", 
        "pref_read": 16384, 
        "max_read": 32768, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516098997, 
        "enabled": true, 
        "character_encoding": "UTF-8", 
        "transport_protocols": "TCP", 
        "anonymous_gid": 65534, 
        "privileged_port": true
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    EXPORT_ILLEGAL_VALUE HTTP 400 The value '"illegal"' of 'inner_path' is illegal
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('TCCP') could not be translated to an expected type
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (-1) of parameter 'anonymous_gid' does not meet a condition: 'must be greater than or equal to 0'
    EXPORT_PERMISSION_CLIENTS_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 400 The number of export rules exceeds the system limit of 1000
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 User 'auto-POOL_ADMIN-d0751339-1' is forbidden to modify filesystem 'auto-filesystem--d2266d70-'
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--48060d6e-')
    EXPORT_FILESYSTEM_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 A new export cannot be created. The filesystem has reached the maximum number of exports
    EXPORT_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 A new export cannot be created. The system has reached the maximum number of exports
    EXPORT_ROOT_ACCESS_CONFLICT HTTP 409 Root permissions cannot be granted on an export with 'squash all users and groups'. Remove one of the two and try again
    EXPORTING_SNAPSHOT_DIRECTORY_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 Exporting an export through its parent filesystem is not allowed. Please export the snapshot directly
    INTERNAL_PATH_NOT_DIR HTTP 409 Internal path '/test' is not a directory within filesystem 'auto-filesystem--6970b5fc-'
    EXPORT_PATH_CONFLICT HTTP 409 An export with this path already exists
    CANNOT_CREATE_EXPORT_FOR_UNESTABLISHED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 Cannot create an export for an unestablished snapshot 'auto-reclaim-rc-1526.0001-1527-1639516445092'
    INTERNAL_PATH_DOES_NOT_EXIST HTTP 409 Internal path '/test' does not exist within filesystem 'auto-filesystem--3fa4dfb2-'

    Delete an Export

    Description Delete an export.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Deleting export 'export_path' will cause all the clients mounted on this export to disconnect
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/exports/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the export
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pref_readdir": 16384, 
        "updated_at": 1639516245490, 
        "id": 30, 
        "pref_write": 16384, 
        "anonymous_uid": 65534, 
        "max_write": 32768, 
        "export_path": "/vol/vol1/truefalse", 
        "32bit_file_id": false, 
        "snapdir_visible": true, 
        "make_all_users_anonymous": false, 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "permissions": [
            {
                "access": "RW", 
                "no_root_squash": true, 
                "client": "*"
            }
        ], 
        "inner_path": "/", 
        "pref_read": 16384, 
        "max_read": 32768, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516245490, 
        "enabled": false, 
        "character_encoding": "UTF-8", 
        "transport_protocols": "TCP", 
        "anonymous_gid": 65534, 
        "privileged_port": true
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Deleting export '/vol//vol1/' will cause all the clients mounted on this export to disconnect
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--7f1d0adc-')

    Get all Exports

    Description Get all of the exports.
    Filterable and Sortable fields:anonymous_gid,anonymous_uid,make_all_users_anonymous,character_encoding,created_at,enabled,export_path,32bit_file_id,id,inner_path,snapdir_visible,max_read,max_write,pref_read,pref_readdir,pref_write,privileged_port,transport_protocols,updated_at.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/exports

    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 1, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "pref_readdir": 16384, 
            "updated_at": 1639516255885, 
            "id": 688, 
            "pref_write": 16384, 
            "anonymous_uid": 65534, 
            "max_write": 32768, 
            "export_path": "/vol//vol1/", 
            "32bit_file_id": false, 
            "snapdir_visible": false, 
            "make_all_users_anonymous": false, 
            "filesystem_id": 1001, 
            "permissions": [
                {
                    "access": "RW", 
                    "no_root_squash": true, 
                    "client": "*"
                }
            ], 
            "inner_path": "/", 
            "pref_read": 16384, 
            "max_read": 32768, 
            "tenant_id": 1, 
            "created_at": 1639516255885, 
            "enabled": true, 
            "character_encoding": "UTF-8", 
            "transport_protocols": "TCP", 
            "anonymous_gid": 65534, 
            "privileged_port": true
        }
    ], 
    "error": null

    Get an Export

    Description Get an export.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/exports/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the export
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pref_readdir": 16384, 
        "updated_at": 1639516255885, 
        "id": 688, 
        "pref_write": 16384, 
        "anonymous_uid": 65534, 
        "max_write": 32768, 
        "export_path": "/vol//vol1/", 
        "32bit_file_id": false, 
        "snapdir_visible": false, 
        "make_all_users_anonymous": false, 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "permissions": [
            {
                "access": "RW", 
                "no_root_squash": true, 
                "client": "*"
            }
        ], 
        "inner_path": "/", 
        "pref_read": 16384, 
        "max_read": 32768, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516255885, 
        "enabled": true, 
        "character_encoding": "UTF-8", 
        "transport_protocols": "TCP", 
        "anonymous_gid": 65534, 
        "privileged_port": true
    }, 
    "error": null

    Errors See general list of error codes.

    Update an Export

    Description Update export attributes.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Disabling export 'export_path' will cause all clients mounted on this export to disconnect
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/exports/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the export
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "enabled": false
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pref_readdir": 16384, 
        "updated_at": 1639516256945, 
        "id": 688, 
        "pref_write": 16384, 
        "anonymous_uid": 65534, 
        "max_write": 32768, 
        "export_path": "/vol//vol1/", 
        "32bit_file_id": false, 
        "snapdir_visible": false, 
        "make_all_users_anonymous": false, 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "permissions": [
            {
                "access": "RW", 
                "no_root_squash": true, 
                "client": "*"
            }
        ], 
        "inner_path": "/", 
        "pref_read": 16384, 
        "max_read": 32768, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516255885, 
        "enabled": true, 
        "character_encoding": "UTF-8", 
        "transport_protocols": "TCP", 
        "anonymous_gid": 65534, 
        "privileged_port": true
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('export_path')
    EXPORT_ILLEGAL_VALUE HTTP 400 The value '100000000' of 'max_write' is illegal. The value must be between 16384 and 16777216
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (127.0.0.1,192.168.0.3) of parameter 'permissions' does not meet a condition: '*, valid IP or IP range'
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('a') could not be translated to an expected type
    NOT_SUPPORTED_MULTIPLE_UPDATE HTTP 400 This resource does not support updating multiple fields in one request
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Disabling export '/vol//vol1/' will cause all clients mounted on this export to disconnect
    EXPORT_IS_ENABLED HTTP 409 The operation is prohibited on an enabled export
    TARGET_REPLICA_EXPORT_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 A replica target cannot be exported
    EXPORT_ROOT_ACCESS_CONFLICT HTTP 409 Root permissions cannot be granted on an export with 'squash all users and groups'. Remove one of the two and try again
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--1b12ba67-')
    INTERNAL_PATH_NOT_DIR HTTP 409 Internal path '/' is not a directory within filesystem 'auto-filesystem--6970b5fc-'

    FC Port

    Disable FC Port

    Description disable fc port
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Disabling this FC port may lead to a degraded host connectivity or a complete host disconnection
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/components/racks/{rackId}/nodes/{id}/fc_ports/{fc}/disable
    URL Parameters
    id String The node id
    fc int The port id
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "connection_speed": null, 
        "state_description": "", 
        "hba_port_number": 1, 
        "sfp_type": null, 
        "link_state": null, 
        "soft_target_addresses": [], 
        "id": 1, 
        "sfp_model": null, 
        "wwnn": "57:42:b0:f0:00:00:13:00", 
        "qla_errs": 0, 
        "hardware_revision": null, 
        "firmware": null, 
        "state": "OK", 
        "role": "HARD_PORT", 
        "switch_vendor": "", 
        "vendor": "QLogic", 
        "last_probe_timestamp": 1390254043000, 
        "max_speed": null, 
        "probe_ttl": 10000, 
        "enabled": false, 
        "node_index": 1, 
        "system_interface_port_number": 1, 
        "wwpn": "57:42:b0:f0:00:00:13:11", 
        "model": "unknown", 
        "switch_wwnn": ""
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Disabling this FC port may lead to a degraded host connectivity or a complete host disconnection
    PORT_ALREADY_DISABLED HTTP 409 Cannot disable a disabled port

    FC Switch

    Description Delete fc switch from the system
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/fc/switches/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long The id of the fc switch to delete
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "wwnn": "wwnn", 
        "vendor": "skynet2", 
        "resiliency_state": "N/A", 
        "resiliency_bitmap": null, 
        "id": 211, 
        "name": "2"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    FC_SWITCH_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 FC switch not found
    FC_SWITCH_NOT_DISCONNECTED HTTP 409 FC switch '2' is not disconnected - Please disconnect it first
