    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 4, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        -2, 
        -1, 
        3213, 
        3214
    ], 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    POOL_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Pool not found

    Lock a Pool

    Description Lock the pool for writes.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Locking a pool prevents any changes to existing datasets, as well as creating new ones
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/pools/{id}/lock
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the pool
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Locking a pool prevents any changes to existing datasets, as well as creating new ones
    POOL_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Pool not found

    Unlock Pool

    Description Unlock the pool, allow writing into its entities.
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/pools/{id}/unlock
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the pool
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns
    Errors
    POOL_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Pool not found

    Update a Pool Attribute

    Description Update an attribute of a pool. For example: set the pool capacity to be compressed by setting the value of compression_enabled to yes
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/pools/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the pool
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "name": "storage2"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "volumes_count": 0, 
        "updated_at": 1639516319134, 
        "max_extend": -1, 
        "allocated_physical_space": 0, 
        "free_virtual_space": 1000000192512, 
        "id": 1000, 
        "reserved_capacity": 100000000000, 
        "filesystems_count": 0, 
        "ssd_enabled": true, 
        "snapshots_count": 0, 
        "state": "NORMAL", 
        "type": "VVOL", 
        "free_physical_space": 1000000192512, 
        "entities_count": 0, 
        "owners": [], 
        "capacity_savings": null, 
        "name": "storage2", 
        "virtual_capacity": 1000000192512, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516319043, 
        "filesystem_snapshots_count": 0, 
        "compression_enabled": true, 
        "qos_policies": [], 
        "physical_capacity_warning": 80, 
        "physical_capacity": 1000000192512, 
        "physical_capacity_critical": 90
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'auto-invalid*name-ab7fa93f'
    MISSING_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request is empty
    SET_MISSING_ATTRIBUTE HTTP 400 Attribute not found: 'nonExistingAttribute'
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('name') could not be translated to an expected type
    INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (null) of parameter 'owner' does not meet a condition: 'must be a valid owner'
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('entities_count')
    ILLEGAL_THRESHOLD_VALUE HTTP 400 Illegal threshold value: 0
    NOT_SUPPORTED_MULTIPLE_UPDATE HTTP 400 This resource does not support updating multiple fields in one request
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    POOL_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Pool not found
    USER_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 User not found
    SYSTEM_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 Used virtual space reached system virtual capacity
    POOL_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 An entity with this name already exists
    ILLEGAL_WARNING_OR_CRITICAL_VALUE HTTP 409 Illegal value 91. Critical value (90) must be greater than warning value (91)
    ILLEGAL_POOL_ADMIN HTTP 409 A non-POOL_ADMIN user cannot be assigned as a pool admin
    ILLEGAL_POOL_PHYSICAL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 The requested physical capacity is not allowed
    ILLEGAL_POOL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 The requested capacity is not allowed. Reason: Pool size is not aligned with integral units of 512. Wrong capacity value: 1000GB

    Quality of Service

    The QoS policy is a logical entity that groups performance capping levels. The capping level are imposed on entities (pools or individual datasets) that are assigned to the policy. The performance capping levels are comprised of the following:

    • Max IOPS - the maximum number of IOPS / FOPS (IOPS for volumes, FOPS for filesystems) that are allowed for a volume / filesystem
    • Max MBPS - the maximum bandwidth that is assigned to a volume / filesystem
    • Burst - a time-limited increase in performance, related to the MAX IOPS and Max MBPS that are specified in the policy
    • Burst factor - the factor of increased performance during the burst. The burst cannot exceed this factor
    • Burst duration - the maximum amount of time the burst can last

    To apply performance capping to an entity:

    1. Create a policy
    2. Assign an entity to a policy

    Assign an Entity to a QoS Policy

    Description Once you defined a QoS Policy, you can assign entities to it.
    User approval will be required in each, or both cases:
    1. When moving an entity from one QoS policy to another
    2. When consequent to this operation, the limits of any entity's shared policy will be lower than those of its direct policy.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    You are trying to assign entityType 'entityName' to a QoS policy it is already assigned to: 'qosPolicyName'
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/qos/policies/{qos_policy_id}/assign
    URL Parameters
    qos_policy_id long ID of the QoS Policy
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "entity_id": 1001
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "entity_id": 1001, 
        "qos_policy_id": 1006, 
        "entity_name": "auto-pool--160c3588-c05a-4", 
        "entity_type": "POOL", 
        "created_at": 1639516447711, 
        "updated_at": 1639516447711, 
        "id": 2426
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('entity_id') could not be translated to an expected type
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 You are trying to assign volume 'auto-volume--0fcbc2da-745d' to a QoS policy it is already assigned to: 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-fb10b7'
    QOS_POLICY_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 QoS policy with ID 1001 was not found
    REPLICA_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE HTTP 409 Replication feature not yet supported: Assigning an active-active replicated entity to a QoS policy
    QOS_RESOURCE_ADD_FAIL HTTP 409 Failed to assign volume 'auto-volume--24b3166c-5f10' to QoS policy 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-cc9ab7'
    QOS_EXPECTED_ENTITY_NOT_FOUND HTTP 409 The expected QoS entity of type VOLUME was not found
    QOS_ASSIGNED_PER_POLICY_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 QoS assigned entities per policy count limit reached

    Create a QoS Policy

    Description Create a QoS Policy
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/qos/policies/
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "name": "auto-QoSPolicy4Test-3815e9", 
    "max_ops": 10000, 
    "burst_enabled": true, 
    "max_bps": 262144000, 
    "burst_factor": 1.1, 
    "type": "POOL_VOLUME"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "name": "auto-QoSPolicy4Test-3815e9", 
        "max_ops": 10000, 
        "created_at": 1639516447611, 
        "burst_enabled": true, 
        "updated_at": 1639516447611, 
        "max_bps": 262144000, 
        "burst_factor": 1.1, 
        "burst_duration_seconds": 60, 
        "type": "POOL_VOLUME", 
        "id": 1006
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (null) of parameter 'type' does not meet a condition: 'may not be null'
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'bad<:name;>'
    INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('name') is missing in an object passed
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('type') could not be translated to an expected type
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    QOS_POLICY_MAX_LIMIT_NOT_DEFINED HTTP 409 QoS policy 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-cf4202' is missing at least one defined limit: Max OPS or Max BPS
    QOS_POLICY_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 QoS policy count limit reached
    QOS_POLICY_INVALID_BURST_PARAMETER HTTP 409 The burst_factor must be between 1.1 and 10.0. A valid input needs to be no more than 1 decimal point. The value: 10.01 is invalid
    FEATURE_NOT_ENABLED HTTP 409 QoS for filesystem feature is not enabled
    QOS_POLICY_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 A QoS policy with this name 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-8c0608' already exists
    QOS_POLICY_INVALID_MAX_LIMIT HTTP 409 The max_ops limit must be between 1000 and 10000000. The value: 10000001 is invalid

    Delete a QoS Policy

    Description Delete a QoS Policy
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Deleting a QoS policy with assigned entities will affect the performance of these entities
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/qos/policies/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the QoS Policy
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "name": "auto-QoSPolicy4Test-9787b3", 
        "max_ops": 1000, 
        "created_at": 1639517072283, 
        "burst_enabled": true, 
        "updated_at": 1639517072283, 
        "max_bps": 52428800, 
        "burst_factor": 1.1, 
        "burst_duration_seconds": 60, 
        "type": "VOLUME", 
        "id": 1000
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Deleting a QoS policy with assigned entities will affect the performance of these entities
    QOS_POLICY_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 QoS policy with ID 9999999 was not found

    "name": null

        "ready": true

    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'bad<:name;>'

    QOS_POLICY_INVALID_MAX_LIMIT HTTP 409 The max_ops limit must be between 1000 and 10000000. The value: 10000001 is invalid
    FEATURE_NOT_ENABLED HTTP 409 QoS for filesystem feature is not enabled
    QOS_POLICY_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 A QoS policy with this name 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-5a343a' already exists
    QOS_POLICY_INVALID_BURST_PARAMETER HTTP 409 The burst_factor must be between 1.1 and 10.0. A valid input needs to be no more than 1 decimal point. The value: 10.01 is invalid
    QOS_POLICY_MAX_LIMIT_NOT_DEFINED HTTP 409 QoS policy 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-445e07' is missing at least one defined limit: Max OPS or Max BPS

    Replica

    Change Replica Role

    Description Change replica role.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Changing the replicated dataset role from source to target will make the dataset write-disabled
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/replicas/{id}/change_role
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    retain_staging_area boolean Determines whether to retain the staging area of the replica
    keep_datasets_write_protected boolean Determines whether to keep the datasets write protected when changing the replica role to SOURCE
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "async_mode": null, 
        "state_description": null, 
        "local_cg_id": null, 
        "_assigned_remote_ip": "2.2.2.2", 
        "remote_cg_id": null, 
        "rpo_state": null, 
        "temporary_failure_retry_count": 100, 
        "remote_replica_id": 1639516267578, 
        "domino": null, 
        "updated_at": 1639516268005, 
        "link_id": 329, 
        "pending_job_count": 0, 
        "started_at": null, 
        "id": 337, 
        "reserved_for_infinisafe": true, 
        "next_job_start_time": null, 
        "_is_internal_source": null, 
        "_management_configuration_version": "390ecc76-2df9-4c65-b351-2d389d68b067", 
        "state_reason": null, 
        "local_pool_id": 1002, 
        "permanent_failure_wait_interval": 1200000, 
        "_assigned_sync_remote_ips": null, 
        "entity_type": "VOLUME", 
        "job_state": null, 
        "concurrent_replica": false, 
        "remote_entity_name": "auto-volume--223ef693-db93", 
        "state": null, 
        "sync_interval": 240000, 
        "role": "TARGET", 
        "suspended_from_local": null, 
        "remote_cg_name": null, 
        "_enabled": false, 
        "is_initial": null, 
        "_assigned_local_ip_index": 0, 
        "local_pool_name": "auto-pool--e9ca9f70-7819-4", 
        "jobs": [], 
        "description": "auto-Replica--d963a702-b4f", 
        "mobility_source": null, 
        "sync_state": null, 
        "staging_area_allocated_size": null, 
        "_replica_configuration_version": "f27520e4-942e-494d-8128-480bc351016a", 
        "_local_reclaimed_sg_id": null, 
        "last_synchronized": null, 
        "restore_point": 1234567890, 
        "remote_pool_name": "auto-pool--e9ca9f70-7819-4", 
        "_remote_ip_addresses": null, 
        "progress": null, 
        "_snapshot_time": 1234567890, 
        "is_preferred": null, 
        "rpo_value": 300000, 
        "latency": null, 
... TRUNCATED ...
    Errors
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges for using 'keep_datasets_write_protected' flag
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Changing the replicated dataset role from source to target will make the dataset write-disabled
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 User 'auto-POOL_ADMIN-1cb6dbd1-2' is forbidden to modify pool 'auto-pool--b4beb5ca-5df1-4'
    OPERATION_CANNOT_BE_DONE_ON_ACTIVE_ACTIVE_REPLICA HTTP 409 Change Role failed because it is not supported for active-active replica
    REPLICATED_CG_IS_EMPTY HTTP 409 change-role is not allowed when the replicated consistency group is empty
    DATASET_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 The request exceeds the dataset count limit
    OPERATION_CANNOT_BE_DONE_ON_CONCURRENT_ASYNC_REPLICA HTTP 409 Change Role failed because it is not supported for concurrent async replica
    REPLICA_ONLY_ALLOWED_WHEN_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 Changing the replica role from source to target is only allowed when replica is suspended
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Changing a filesystem replica's role with retain_staging_area is not supported
    REPLICA_INCONSISTENT_DATASETS HTTP 409 Changing role cannot be completed because at least one dataset has not reached a consistent state
    REPLICA_IS_RESERVED_FOR_INFINISAFE HTTP 409 Replica is reserved for infinisafe, changing the replica role is not allowed
    REPLICA_INVALID_LINK HTTP 409 The link is detached
    REPLICA_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE HTTP 409 Replication feature not yet supported: Only async replicas can keep the datasets write protected

    Change Replica Type to Async

    Description Change replica type to async
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Changing the replica to asynchronous type will periodically send the data to the remote system
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/replicas/{id}/change_type_to_async
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "async_mode": null, 
        "state_description": null, 
        "_assigned_sync_remote_ips": null, 
        "_assigned_remote_ip": "2.2.2.2", 
        "remote_cg_id": null, 
        "rpo_state": null, 
        "temporary_failure_retry_count": 100, 
        "remote_replica_id": 1639516567294, 
        "domino": null, 
        "updated_at": 1639516568093, 
        "link_id": 457, 
        "pending_job_count": 0, 
        "started_at": null, 
        "id": 465, 
        "reserved_for_infinisafe": false, 
        "next_job_start_time": null, 
        "_is_internal_source": null, 
        "_management_configuration_version": "b67857bb-39e7-4d91-8bdd-e1155b8b8ea8",

    Change Replica Type to Sync

    Description Change replica type to sync
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Changing the replica to synchronous type will continuously send data to the remote system
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/replicas/{id}/change_type_to_sync
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN

    REPLICA_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE HTTP 409 Replication feature not yet supported: Only block datasets can be SYNC replicated

    Delete a Replica

    Description Delete a replica
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Force delete will delete the replica locally only, the remote replica will not be deleted
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/replicas/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    retain_staging_area boolean Determines whether to retain the staging area of the replica
    keep_serial_on_local Boolean Allows keeping or resetting the external identification data of the local replica volume/s
    force_if_no_remote_credentials Boolean Allow this operation even if a login error is returned by the remote system
    force_if_remote_error Boolean Allow this operation even if an error is returned by the remote system
    force_on_target Boolean Allow one-sided operation on the target
    force_on_local Boolean Allow one-sided operation
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "async_mode": null, 
        "state_description": null,

            "2.2.2.6", 
            "2.2.2.7"
        ], 
        "_assigned_remote_ip": "2.2.2.2",

        "rpo_state": null, 
        "temporary_failure_retry_count": 100,

        "link_id": 1050,

        "reserved_for_infinisafe": false, 
        "next_job_start_time": null,

    Get a Replicas Jobs

    Description Get the replica sync jobs that are currently active.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/replicas/{id}/jobs
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN,  READ_ONLY,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 1, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "start_time": 1424084198470, 
            "state": "PAUSED", 
            "end_time": null, 
            "is_initial": false, 
            "type": "SCHEDULED", 
            "id": 1
        }
    ], 
    "error": null
}
    Errors See general list of error codes.

    Get all Replicas

    Description Get all replicas
    Filterable and Sortable fields:_assigned_local_ip_index,concurrent_replica,_consistent_guid,restore_point,created_at,description,domino,_enabled,entity_type,id,is_preferred,local_cg_name,local_entity_id,local_entity_name,local_pool_id,local_pool_name,_local_reclaimed_sg_id,_management_configuration_version,mobility_source,permanent_failure_wait_interval,remote_cg_id,remote_cg_name,remote_entity_id,remote_entity_name,remote_pool_id,remote_pool_name,_remote_reclaimed_sg_id,remote_replica_id,_replica_configuration_version,rpo_type,rpo_value,replication_type,reserved_for_infinisafe,_snapshot_guid,_snapshot_time,suspended_from_local,sync_interval,temporary_failure_retry_count,temporary_failure_retry_interval,updated_at.

    Suspend a Replica

    Description Suspend a replica
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Replica is reserved for infinisafe, operation may increase the rpo
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/replicas/{id}/suspend
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN

    Switch Replica Role

    Description Switch replica role
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Switching the roles of replicated datasets changes the source to target and the target to source. Note that when the source switches to target, it becomes write-protected
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/replicas/{id}/switch_role
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the replica
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns

    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    },

    NON_SYNCHRONIZED_REPLICA_CANNOT_SWITCH_ROLE HTTP 409 The replica has to be in Synchronized state in order to allow a role switch

    System States ALL

        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": null, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors

    OPERATION_CANNOT_BE_DONE_ON_ACTIVE_ACTIVE_REPLICA HTTP 409 Sync now failed because it is not supported for active-active replica
    REPLICA_NOT_ALLOWED_WHEN_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 sync now is not allowed when replica is suspended
    REPLICA_INVALID_REPLICATION_TYPE HTTP 409 This operation cannot be performed on SYNC replica
    REPLICATED_CG_IS_EMPTY HTTP 409 sync now is not allowed when the replicated consistency group is empty

    OPERATION_CANNOT_BE_DONE_ON_ACTIVE_ACTIVE_REPLICA HTTP 409 Update replica failed because it is not supported for active-active replica

    San Clients

    Get all San Clients

    Description Get all of the SAN Clients in the system.
    Filterable and Sortable fields:
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/san_clients
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 2, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "luns": [], 
            "name": "cluster6", 
            "tenant_id": 1, 
            "created_at": 1639516501792, 
            "host_type": "DEFAULT", 
            "updated_at": 1639516501792, 
            "san_client_type": "CLUSTER", 
            "hosts": [
                {
                    "luns": [], 
                    "security_method": "NONE", 
                    "security_chap_inbound_username": null, 
                    "name": "host6", 
                    "tenant_id": 1, 
                    "created_at": 1639516501603, 
                    "host_type": "DEFAULT", 
                    "updated_at": 1639516501603, 
                    "id": 1005, 
                    "san_client_type": "HOST", 
                    "optimized": true, 
                    "security_chap_has_outbound_secret": false,

    Search

    Search

    Description
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/search
    URL Parameters
    query String
    type String
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 1, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "keywords": null, 
            "properties": {
                "volume_type": "SNAPSHOT"
            }, 
            "type": "volume", 
            "id": 1003, 
            "name": "auto-infinidat-snap-1-0d35"
        }
    ], 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MAX_PAGE_SIZE_VIOLATION HTTP 400 Requested page size 1001 exceeds range 1..1000 for command 'Search'
    UNSEARCHABLE_TYPE HTTP 400 Requested entity type 'users' is not searchable

    Services Component

    Get Service

    Stop Service

    Description
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Service deactivation can cause loss of functionality
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/services/{service}/stop
    URL Parameters
    service String Service name
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ACTIVE
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "node_states": [
            {
                "state": "INACTIVE", 
                "node_id": 1, 
                "role": "NONE"
            }
        ], 
        "name": "nas", 
        "cluster_state": "ACTIVE"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('kind') could not be translated to an expected type
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Service deactivation can cause loss of functionality
    ILLEGAL_NODE_ID HTTP 404 Illegal node ID 10. Legal values 1
    SERVICE_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Service not found: 'NonExistingServiceBluBlu'

    Delete Soft Target

    Description Delete soft target from the system
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Deleting a soft target might cause paths disconnections. Depending on the host's configuration this may cause downtime.
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/fc/soft_targets/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long The id of the soft target to delete
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "switch_id": 836, 
        "is_home": false, 
        "node_id": null, 
        "port_number": null, 
        "wwpn": "20:00:74:2B:0F:00:00:13", 
        "id": 837
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Deleting a soft target might cause paths disconnections. Depending on the host's configuration this may cause downtime.

    API Endpoint GET api/rest/components/racks/{rackId}/support_appliances/{saIdx}

    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {

        "vendor": "",

        "firmware": "",

        "state": "ERROR", 
        "model": "", 
        "id": 1

    System

    General system information and operations

    Accept Eula

    Description Accept the eula
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/eula/accepted
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  ADMIN,  POOL_ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "status": "ACCEPTED", 
        "accepted_by": "infinidat", 
        "user_accepted_email": "dev.mgmt@infinidat.com", 
        "eula_snooze_time": 2880, 
        "eula_version": "1.0", 
        "accepted_from": "2.3.4.5", 
        "accepted_on": 1639516222638, 
        "last_snoozed_on": null, 
        "eula_first_snoozed_on": null, 
        "eula_version_accepted": "1.0", 
        "eula_time_left": 43200
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges

    Operational State Shutdown and Poweroff

    Description Shut down and power off the system.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    SHUTTING DOWN THE SYSTEM WILL CAUSE ALL SERVERS TO DISCONNECT
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/operational_state/shutdown_and_poweroff
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL

    Invalid Operation States
    System StatesMethods
    IN_EMERGENCY_SHUTDOWN EMERGENCY_SHUTDOWN NOT_READY ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 SHUTTING DOWN THE SYSTEM WILL CAUSE ALL SERVERS TO DISCONNECT

    Set Kms Disabled

    Description Disable KMS
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Disabling KMS places the systems encryption key in the system, removing the need for KMS during InfiniBox power up
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/kms_disable
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": false, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Disabling KMS places the systems encryption key in the system, removing the need for KMS during InfiniBox power up
    KMS_CANNOT_DISABLE_DUE_TO_ENCRYPTION_MODE HTTP 409 Cannot disable KMS while encryption is enabled

    Set Kms Enabled

    Description Enable KMS
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Enabling KMS places the systems encryption keys in the KMS database and removes them from the system. As a result, should the KMS be inaccessible or corrupt then InfiniBox will fail to power up
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/kms_enable
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": true, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Enabling KMS places the systems encryption keys in the KMS database and removes them from the system. As a result, should the KMS be inaccessible or corrupt then InfiniBox will fail to power up
    KMS_CANNOT_ENABLE_DUE_TO_ENCRYPTION_MODE HTTP 409 Cannot enable KMS while encryption is enabled
    KMS_ENABLE_MANDATORY_FIELDS_MISSING HTTP 409 Cannot enable KMS when some of the following configuration mandatory fields are missing: [kms_servers, kms_ca_certificate, infinibox_kmip_private_key, infinibox_kmip_certificate]
    KMS_FIPS_NOT_ENABLED HTTP 409 Cannot enable KMS if system is not in FIPS mode

    Set Power Maintenance Mode

    Description Enable / disable Power Maintenance Mode
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Power Maintenance Mode prevents InfiniBox from taking automated actions following various power issues. Exception: In case of a total power outage, the system will start Emergency Shutdown regardless
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/system/power_maintenance_mode
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN
    System States ACTIVE
    JSON Data 
    {
    "in_maintenance": true, 
    "force": false, 
    "duration_seconds": 1800
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "in_maintenance": true, 
        "duration_seconds": 1800
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Power Maintenance Mode prevents InfiniBox from taking automated actions following various power issues. Exception: In case of a total power outage, the system will start Emergency Shutdown regardless

    Set the System Name

    Description Set the system name
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/system/name
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT

    "\"\""

    Set Total Virtual Capacity

    Description Set system total virtual capacity
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Extending the system virtual capacity requires INFINIDAT support approval
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/system/capacity/total_virtual_capacity
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    "9007199257362432"
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": 9007199257362432, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Extending the system virtual capacity requires INFINIDAT support approval
    SYSTEM_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY_LESS_THAN_HARD HTTP 409 System virtual capacity cannot be less than hard capacity
    SYSTEM_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY_LESS_THAN_USED HTTP 409 System virtual capacity cannot be less than current total provisioned soft capacity
    MAX_SYSTEM_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY_LIMIT HTTP 409 System virtual capacity maximum limit will be exceeded

    }, 
    "error": null
}

    Upgrade the Gui and Infinishell Software

    Description Install the GUI and InfiniShell upgrade packages.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    This operation is irreversible. In addition, the GUI and InfiniShell are not available during the update
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/system/upgrade
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": null, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 This operation is irreversible. In addition, the GUI and InfiniShell are not available during the update
    UPGRADE_FILE_INVALID HTTP 409 Upgrade file is invalid: file is empty

    TreeQ

    Create a TreeQ

    Description Create a TreeQ
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/filesystems/{fsId}/treeqs
    URL Parameters
    fsId long Filesystem ID
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "soft_inodes": 2, 
    "path": "/treeqPath1", 
    "hard_capacity": 1000000000, 
    "hard_inodes": 50, 
    "name": "treeqName1"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "name": "treeqName1", 
        "soft_capacity": null, 
        "hard_inodes": 50, 
        "capacity_state": "BELOW_SOFT", 
        "hard_capacity": 1000000000, 
        "used_inodes": 1, 
        "soft_inodes": 2, 
        "path": "/treeqPath1", 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "used_capacity": 0, 
        "id": 21955048183431200, 
        "inodes_state": "BELOW_SOFT"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('name') is missing in an object passed
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('capacity_state')
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'null'
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 User 'auto-POOL_ADMIN-c3597e5e-6' is forbidden to modify filesystem 'auto-filesystem--637e5fc8-'
    TREEQ_ILLEGAL_VALUE HTTP 409 The value '"/"' of 'path' is illegal. TreeQ path is too short, minimum length is 2
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_INODE_HARD_TOO_HIGH HTTP 409 TreeQ hard iNodes cannot be greater than 1000000000000000000
    TREEQ_INVALID_PATH HTTP 409 Invalid TreeQ path
    TREEQ_PATH_MISMATCH HTTP 409 TreeQ path '/MySnapshotDir' cannot be identical to the name of a filesystem snapshot directory
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--0e2ce9cf-')
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_INODE_HARD_BELOW_SOFT HTTP 409 TreeQ hard iNodes has to be at least 1 above soft iNodes
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_SOFT_TOO_LOW HTTP 409 TreeQ soft capacity limit is too low, minimum is 500MB
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_HARD_TOO_LOW HTTP 409 TreeQ hard capacity limit is too low, minimum is 1GB
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_SOFT_TOO_HIGH HTTP 409 TreeQ soft capacity cannot be greater than 1000000000000000000
    TREEQ_PATH_TOO_LONG HTTP 409 TreeQ path is too long, maximum length is 255
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_INODE_INTERVAL_TOO_SMALL HTTP 409 TreeQ hard iNodes has to be at least 1 above soft iNodes
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_HARD_BELOW_SOFT HTTP 409 TreeQ hard capacity has to be at least 100MB above soft capacity
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_HARD_TOO_HIGH HTTP 409 TreeQ hard capacity cannot be greater than 1000000000000000000
    TREEQ_NAME_ALREADY_EXISTS HTTP 409 TreeQ name already exists in filesystem
    TREEQ_FILESYSTEM_READ_ONLY HTTP 409 Filesystem is write protected
    TREEQ_PATH_NESTING HTTP 409 TreeQ is only supported on the filesystem root folder
    TREEQ_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 TreeQ operations are not supported while the filesystem is a replication target
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_INODE_SOFT_TOO_HIGH HTTP 409 TreeQ soft iNodes cannot be greater than 1000000000000000000
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_INODE_HARD_TOO_LOW HTTP 409 TreeQ hard iNodes limit is too low, minimum is 3
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_INODE_SOFT_TOO_LOW HTTP 409 TreeQ soft iNodes limit is too low, minimum is 2
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_INTERVAL_TOO_SMALL HTTP 409 TreeQ hard capacity has to be at least 100MB above soft capacity

    Get a TreeQ

    Description Return a TreeQ by ID
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/filesystems/{fsId}/treeqs/{id}
    URL Parameters
    fsId long Filesystem ID
    id long TreeQ ID
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "name": "treeqName1", 
        "soft_capacity": null, 
        "hard_inodes": 50, 
        "capacity_state": "BELOW_SOFT", 
        "hard_capacity": 1000000000, 
        "used_inodes": 1, 
        "soft_inodes": 2, 
        "path": "/treeqPath1", 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "used_capacity": 0, 
        "id": 21955048183431200, 
        "inodes_state": "BELOW_SOFT"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--36d397a5-')
    TREEQ_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 TreeQ operations are not supported while the filesystem is a replication target

    Get all Filesystem TreeQ

    Description Return all of the TreeQ of a filesystem
    Filterable and Sortable fields:capacity_state,filesystem_id,hard_capacity,hard_inodes,id,inodes_state,name,path,soft_capacity,soft_inodes,used_capacity,used_inodes.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/filesystems/{fsId}/treeqs
    URL Parameters
    fsId long Filesystem ID
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 2, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "name": "treeqName1", 
            "soft_capacity": null, 
            "hard_inodes": 50, 
            "capacity_state": "BELOW_SOFT", 
            "hard_capacity": 1000000000, 
            "used_inodes": 3, 
            "soft_inodes": 2, 
            "path": "/treeqPath1", 
            "filesystem_id": 1001, 
            "used_capacity": 1000, 
            "id": 21955048183431200, 
            "inodes_state": "SOFT_EXCEEDED"
        }, 
        {
            "name": "treeqName2", 
            "soft_capacity": null, 
            "hard_inodes": 321, 
            "capacity_state": "BELOW_SOFT", 
            "hard_capacity": 321, 
            "used_inodes": 321, 
            "soft_inodes": 2, 
            "path": "/treeqPath2", 
            "filesystem_id": 1001, 
            "used_capacity": 300, 
            "id": 21955048183431201, 
            "inodes_state": "NONE"
        }
    ], 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    NOT_FILTERABLE_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains a field that cannot be filtered: ('mode')
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('aaaaa')
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('123') could not be translated to an expected type
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (null) of parameter 'BETWEEN' does not meet a condition: 'not null'
    TREEQ_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 TreeQ operations are not supported while the filesystem is a replication target
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--36d397a5-')

    Remove a TreeQ

    Description Remove a TreeQ by ID
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/filesystems/{fsId}/treeqs/{id}
    URL Parameters
    fsId long Filesystem ID
    id long TreeQ ID
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "name": "treeqName1", 
        "soft_capacity": null, 
        "hard_inodes": 50, 
        "capacity_state": "BELOW_SOFT", 
        "hard_capacity": 1000000000, 
        "used_inodes": 1, 
        "soft_inodes": 2, 
        "path": "/treeqPath1", 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "used_capacity": 0, 
        "id": 21955048183431200, 
        "inodes_state": "BELOW_SOFT"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 User 'auto-POOL_ADMIN-f437f44c-4' is forbidden to modify filesystem 'auto-filesystem--f49dfda0-'
    TREEQ_FILESYSTEM_READ_ONLY HTTP 409 Filesystem is write protected
    TREEQ_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 TreeQ operations are not supported while the filesystem is a replication target
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--8388b284-')

    Update a TreeQ Attribute

    Description Update an attribute of a TreeQ
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/filesystems/{fsId}/treeqs/{id}
    URL Parameters
    fsId long Filesystem ID
    id long TreeQ ID
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "name": "treeqName1"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "name": "treeqName1", 
        "soft_capacity": null, 
        "hard_inodes": 50, 
        "capacity_state": "BELOW_SOFT", 
        "hard_capacity": 1000000000, 
        "used_inodes": 1, 
        "soft_inodes": 2, 
        "path": "/treeqPath1", 
        "filesystem_id": 1001, 
        "used_capacity": 0, 
        "id": 21955048183431200, 
        "inodes_state": "BELOW_SOFT"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('path')
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'null'
    MISSING_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request is empty
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 User 'auto-POOL_ADMIN-39cc13bb-9' is forbidden to modify filesystem 'auto-filesystem--ca6a38d5-'
    TREEQ_ILLEGAL_VALUE HTTP 409 The value '"/y"' of 'name' is illegal. Cannot update name together with limits
    TREEQ_FILESYSTEM_READ_ONLY HTTP 409 Filesystem is write protected
    TREEQ_INVALID_LIMITS_CAPACITY_INTERVAL_TOO_SMALL HTTP 409 TreeQ hard capacity has to be at least 100MB above soft capacity
    FILESYSTEM_IS_SUSPENDED HTTP 409 The operation cannot be performed as the filesystem is suspended ('auto-filesystem--d2b96a0f-')
    TREEQ_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 TreeQ operations are not supported while the filesystem is a replication target

    Ups

    Get all Upss

    Description Return Racks' upss
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/components/racks/{rackId}/ups
    URL Parameters none
    Roles INFINIDAT,  TECHNICIAN,  POOL_ADMIN,  READ_ONLY,  ADMIN
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 3, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "output_voltage_nominal": 0.0, 
            "state_description": "", 
            "output_current": 0.0,

    Users Repository

    Create a User Repository

    Description Create a repository of users whose members can log into InfiniBox.
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/config/ldap
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "name": "auto-filter_sort_-f1439b42", 
    "schema_definition": {
        "group_memberof_attribute": "memberof", 
        "group_name_attribute": "cn", 
        "groups_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local", 
        "users_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local", 
        "username_attribute": "sAMAccountName", 
        "group_class": "group", 
        "user_class": "user"
    }, 
    "bind_username": "administrator", 
    "servers": null, 
    "domain_name": "mgmt.local", 
    "bind_password": "Xsignnet1"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "ldap_port": 636, 
        "name": "auto-filter_sort_-f1439b42", 
        "schema_definition": {
            "group_memberof_attribute": "memberof", 
            "group_name_attribute": "cn", 
            "group_class": "group", 
            "user_class": "user", 
            "username_attribute": "sAMAccountName", 
            "groups_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local", 
            "users_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local"
        }, 
        "use_ldaps": true, 
        "domain_name": "mgmt.local", 
        "bind_username": "administrator", 
        "search_order": 0, 
        "servers": null, 
        "repository_type": "ActiveDirectory", 
        "id": 589
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    UNSUPPORTED_VALUE HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported value () for field ('servers')
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_DOMAIN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid domain name
    INVALID_PARAMETER_LENGTH HTTP 400 Parameter ('bind_username') length must be between 1 and 255 characters. Actual: 300
    LDAP_SERVERS_LIMIT HTTP 409 Maximum servers in LDAP repository reached. Please set up to 3 different servers
    LDAP_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 LDAP name 'dev' already configured
    DOMAIN_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 Domain name 'mgmt.local' already configured
    LDAP_REPOSITORIES_LIMIT HTTP 409 LDAP repositories count has reached the limit of 2

    Delete a User Repository

    Description Disconnect a repository from InfiniBox.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    LDAP server ldap has configured groups. Removing the server will remove the groups as well
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/config/ldap/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the repository
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "ldap_port": 636, 
        "name": "repo2", 
        "schema_definition": {
            "group_memberof_attribute": "memberof", 
            "group_name_attribute": "cn", 
            "group_class": "group", 
            "user_class": "user", 
            "username_attribute": "sAMAccountName", 
            "groups_basedn": "", 
            "users_basedn": ""
        }, 
        "use_ldaps": true, 
        "domain_name": null, 
        "bind_username": "administrator", 
        "search_order": 1, 
        "servers": [
            "1.0.0.3", 
            "1.0.0.9"
        ], 
        "repository_type": "LDAP", 
        "id": 5918
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 LDAP server repo1 has configured groups. Removing the server will remove the groups as well

    Description Get a repository that is connected to InfiniBox.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/config/ldap/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the repository
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "ldap_port": 636, 
        "name": "repo1", 
        "schema_definition": {
            "group_memberof_attribute": "memberof", 
            "group_name_attribute": "cn", 
            "group_class": "group", 
            "user_class": "user", 
            "username_attribute": "sAMAccountName", 
            "groups_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local", 
            "users_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local"
        }, 
        "use_ldaps": true, 
        "domain_name": "mgmt.local", 
        "bind_username": "administrator", 
        "search_order": 0, 
        "servers": [], 
        "repository_type": "ActiveDirectory", 
        "id": 5979
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    USERS_REPOSITORY_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Invalid user repository ID

                "users_basedn": "cn=users,dc=mgmt,dc=local"

            "use_ldaps": true, 
            "domain_name": "mgmt2.local", 
            "bind_username": "administrator",

            "servers": [], 
            "repository_type": "ActiveDirectory",

    ],

    Reload

    API Endpoint POST api/rest/config/ldap/reload

    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": null, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors See general list of error codes.

    Reorder

    Description Reorder the search priority of ldap repositories
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/config/ldap/set_order
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    [
    6133, 
    6131, 
    -1
]
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": true, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors

    MISSING_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request is empty
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('[0]') could not be translated to an expected type
    USERS_REPOSITORY_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Invalid user repository ID

    Update the Repository Attributes

    Description Update the repository definition.
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/config/ldap/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the repository
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "servers": [
        "1.0.0.9"
    ]
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "ldap_port": 636, 
        "name": "repo2", 
        "schema_definition": {
            "group_memberof_attribute": "memberof", 
            "group_name_attribute": "cn", 
            "group_class": "group", 
            "user_class": "user", 
            "username_attribute": "sAMAccountName", 
            "groups_basedn": "", 
            "users_basedn": ""
        }, 
        "use_ldaps": true, 
        "domain_name": null, 
        "bind_username": "administrator", 
        "search_order": 1, 
        "servers": [
            "1.0.0.9"
        ], 
        "repository_type": "LDAP", 
        "id": 5918
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('repository_type')
    UNSUPPORTED_VALUE HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported value (1.0.0.3, 1.0.0.3) for field ('servers')
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('servers') could not be translated to an expected type
    LDAP_NAME_CONFLICT HTTP 409 LDAP name 'otherName' already configured
    LDAP_SERVER_CONFLICT HTTP 409 LDAP server(s) 'Server' already configured

    Users

    InfiniBox supports both in-session and basic authentication.

    1. To start a new session, log into InfiniBox using: POST /api/rest/users/login {"username": "jabba", "password": "the hut", "clientid": "optional client identifier"}. Upon a successful login the client receives a cookie {"Set-Cookie", "JSESSIONID=6977862313998501146;Version=1;Path=/״}
    2. Each subsequent request is authenticated with a cookie.
    3. To end the session, log out of InfiniBox using: POST /api/rest/users/logout

    A User object looks like this: 

    {"id": 17, "username": "sherlock", "email": "sherlock@example.com", "role": "ADMIN"}

    Each user belongs to one of the following roles: Admin ,PoolAdmin or ReadOnly. The ReadOnly role provides read-only access to the API. The Admin and PoolAdmin roles provide read-write access.

    Note: user names are case-sensitive.

    Create a User

    Description Add a user to the InfiniBox.
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/users
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "password": "newPass0", 
    "role": "READ_ONLY", 
    "email": "user0@infiniuser.com", 
    "name": "user0"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "password_digest_version": 1, 
        "name": "user0", 
        "roles": [
            "READ_ONLY"
        ], 
        "enabled": true, 
        "id": 255, 
        "role": "READ_ONLY", 
        "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
        "type": "Local", 
        "email": "user0@infiniuser.com"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    INVALID_PASSWORD HTTP 400 Password length must be between 0 and 50 characters and contain only ASCII characters
    ROLE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 400 Cannot assign LDAP users with role INFINIDAT
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('password') is missing in an object passed
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    EMAIL_INVALID_RECIPIENT HTTP 400 Invalid email address: 'null'
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'Lir,an'
    MISSING_ROLE HTTP 400 Cannot have a user without a role
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('password_digest_version')
    WRONG_PARAMETER HTTP 400 The value (-1) of parameter 'password_digest_version' does not meet a condition: 'must be greater than 0 and lower or equal to 1'
    MULTIPLE_ROLES_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 400 A user cannot have multiple roles
    USER_ROLE_CREATE_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 Insufficient privileges to create user with role: [TECHNICIAN]
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges
    USER_ALREADY_EXISTS HTTP 409 User 'foobar1' already exists
    DUPLICATE_DISTINGUISHED_NAME HTTP 409 The Distinguished Name 'cn=all' provided is already mapped to group 'group1' on repository 'mgmt'. Please edit the permissions of this group
    USER_COUNT_LIMIT HTTP 409 User cannot be created: the number of users has reached system limit

    Delete a User

    Description Delete a user
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    After deleting group 'group_name', the group members will no longer be able to log into the system
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/users/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id Long ID of the user
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "password_digest_version": 1, 
        "name": "auto-POOL_ADMIN-bbdc9a78-6", 
        "roles": [
            "POOL_ADMIN"
        ], 
        "enabled": true, 
        "id": 895, 
        "role": "POOL_ADMIN", 
        "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
        "type": "Local", 
        "email": "POOL_ADMIN@infinidat.com"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 After deleting group 'group1', the group members will no longer be able to log into the system
    USER_ROLE_DELETE_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 Insufficient privileges to delete user with role: [INFINIDAT]
    USER_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 User not found
    USER_CANNOT_BE_SELF_DELETED HTTP 409 Users cannot delete themselves

    Disable User

    Description Disable user account
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/users/{id}/disable
    URL Parameters
    id Long ID of the user
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "password_digest_version": 1, 
        "name": "auto-ADMIN-ffd03e67-af24-4", 
        "roles": [
            "ADMIN"
        ], 
        "enabled": false, 
        "id": 3787, 
        "role": "ADMIN", 
        "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
        "type": "Local", 
        "email": "ADMIN@infinidat.com"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED_FOR_ROLE HTTP 403 User with role [TECHNICIAN] is not allowed to perform this action
    USER_CANNOT_BE_SELF_MODIFIED HTTP 409 Users cannot disable themselves

    Do Reset Password

    Description
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/users/{name}/reset_password/{token}
    URL Parameters
    name String Name of the user
    token String
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL

    Invalid Operation States
    System StatesMethods
    LOCAL LOCAL_SHUTDOWN ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "password_digest_version": 1, 
        "name": "admin", 
        "roles": [
            "ADMIN"
        ], 
        "enabled": true, 
        "id": -2, 
        "role": "ADMIN", 
        "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
        "type": "Local", 
        "email": "dev.mgmt@infinidat.com"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    PASSWORD_RESET_REQUEST_EXPIRED HTTP 403 Password reset request has expired
    BAD_USER HTTP 403 Request authentication failed

    Get all Users

    Description Get the InfiniBox users.
    Filterable and Sortable fields:id,name.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/users
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true, 
        "number_of_objects": 3, 
        "pages_total": 1, 
        "page": 1, 
        "page_size": 50
    }, 
    "result": [
        {
            "password_digest_version": 1, 
            "name": "technician", 
            "roles": [
                "TECHNICIAN"
            ], 
            "enabled": true, 
            "id": -3, 
            "role": "TECHNICIAN", 
            "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
            "type": "Local", 
            "email": "dev.mgmt@infinidat.com"
        }, 
        {
            "password_digest_version": 1, 
            "name": "admin", 
            "roles": [
                "ADMIN"
            ], 
            "enabled": true, 
            "id": -2, 
            "role": "ADMIN", 
            "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
            "type": "Local", 
            "email": "dev.mgmt@infinidat.com"
        }, 
        {
            "password_digest_version": 1, 
            "name": "infinidat", 
            "roles": [
                "INFINIDAT"
            ], 
            "enabled": true, 
            "id": -1, 
            "role": "INFINIDAT", 
            "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
            "type": "Local", 
            "email": "dev.mgmt@infinidat.com"
        }
    ], 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED HTTP 401 The operation requires authentication

    Get User Pools

    Description Get all of the pools that the user administers.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/users/{uid}/pools

    Login the User

    Description Login the user.
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/users/login
    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL

    Invalid Operation States
    System StatesMethods
    LOCAL LOCAL_SHUTDOWN ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "username": "shlomo", 
    "password": "the king"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "user_objects": [
            {
                "password_digest_version": 1, 
                "name": "admin", 
                "roles": [
                    "ADMIN"
                ], 
                "enabled": true, 
                "id": -2, 
                "role": "ADMIN", 
                "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
                "type": "Local", 
                "email": "dev.mgmt@infinidat.com"
            }
        ], 
        "name": "admin", 
        "roles": [
            "ADMIN"
        ]
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    BAD_USER HTTP 403 Request authentication failed
    NO_ROLES HTTP 403 User 'uuuu' has no assigned roles

    Modify User Attribute

    Description Modify user attribute
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Disabling a user account will prevent the user from using the system
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/users/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id Long ID of the user
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "password": "new_pass"
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "password_digest_version": 1, 
        "name": "name", 
        "roles": [
            "ADMIN"
        ], 
        "enabled": true, 
        "id": 2832, 
        "role": "ADMIN", 
        "is_digest_sufficient": true, 
        "type": "Local", 
        "email": "name@infinidat.com"
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'Lir,an'
    MISSING_FIELD HTTP 400 A field ('password') is missing in an object passed
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('role') could not be translated to an expected type
    MISSING_ROLE HTTP 400 Cannot have a user without a role
    UNSUPPORTED_FIELD HTTP 400 The request contains an unsupported field ('is_digest_sufficient')
    MISSING_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request is empty
    INVALID_PASSWORD HTTP 400 Password length must be between 0 and 50 characters and contain only ASCII characters
    EMAIL_INVALID_RECIPIENT HTTP 400 Invalid email address: 'nnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn'
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED HTTP 401 The operation requires authentication
    ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED_FOR_ROLE HTTP 403 User with role [TECHNICIAN] is not allowed to perform this action
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Disabling a user account will prevent the user from using the system
    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: Can't modify other user
    USER_ROLE_MODIFY_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 Insufficient privileges to modify user with role: [INFINIDAT]
    USER_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 User not found
    USER_ALREADY_EXISTS HTTP 409 User 'foobar2' already exists
    DUPLICATE_DISTINGUISHED_NAME HTTP 409 The Distinguished Name 'cn=all' provided is already mapped to group 'group1' on repository 'mgmt'. Please edit the permissions of this group
    USER_CANNOT_BE_SELF_MODIFIED HTTP 409 Users cannot modify their own role

    Create a Volume

    Description Create a new volume.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    The active-active replica of entity_name is lagging and the snapshot will reflect the latest consistent data replicated. To get up-to-date data in the snapshot we advise to take the snapshot on the remote system
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/volumes
    URL Parameters none
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL

    Delete a Volume

    Description Delete a volume.
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Deleting the entity 'dataset_name' will also delete all of its snapshots
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/volumes/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the volume
    force_if_snapshot_locked boolean force_if_snapshot_locked
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "paths_available": null, 
        "cg_name": null, 
        "_cg_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "rmr_target": false, 
        "updated_at": 1639516223198,

        "cg_id": null, 
        "qos_policy_name": null,

        "id": 1002,

        "size": 1000000000,

        "parent_id": 0,

        "qos_shared_policy_id": null,

        "pool_name": null,

        "mobility_source": null, 
        "tree_allocated": 0,

            "NONE"
        ], 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_expires_at": null,

        "provtype": "THIN", 
        "qos_policy_id": null,

        "capacity_savings": null,

        "data_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "udid": null, 
        "tenant_id": -1, 
        "created_at": 1639516223198, 
        "pool_id": null, 
        "compression_enabled": false, 
        "family_id": 1002, 
        "depth": 0, 
        "dataset_type": "PROTOCOL_ENDPOINT", 
        "write_protected": false, 
        "mapped": false, 
        "allocated": 0, 
        "rmr_source": false, 
        "rmr_active_active_peer": false, 
        "num_blocks": 1953125
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 User 'auto-POOL_ADMIN-94855d99-2' is forbidden to modify pool 'auto-pool--2283d7e0-8830-4'

    UNAUTHORIZED HTTP 403 You are not authorized for this operation, reason: insufficient privileges for deleting a Protocol Endpoint

    REPLICATED_DATASET_DELETE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 A replicated volume cannot be deleted. Remove the replication, then delete the volume
    ENTITY_ASSIGNED_TO_QOS HTTP 409 The volume 'auto-volume--5817ace3-ade2' is assigned to QoS policy 'auto-QoSPolicy4Test-d1826c' and cannot be deleted
    DELETE_LOCKED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 Snapshot 'snap' is locked, and can only be deleted after '2021-12-19 23:18:52' UTC
    DELETE_SNAPSHOT_WITH_LOCKED_DESCENDANTS HTTP 409 Snapshot 'auto-volume--7df365b0-ac23' has locked descendants, and can only be deleted after they expire, on: '2021-12-19 23:18:56' UTC
    VOLUME_IS_MAPPED HTTP 409 The volume cannot be deleted. Volume 'auto-volume--fd76be6e-e0a5' has active mappings
    CHILD_VOLUMES_ARE_MAPPED HTTP 409 The volume 'auto-volume-test--91f4723a' cannot be deleted. One or more of its children have active mappings
    VOLUME_HAS_RMR_SNAPSHOTS HTTP 409 The volume has replication snapshots

    Get a Volume

    Description Get a volume.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/volumes/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the volume
    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {

    POOL_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 Pool virtual capacity reached
    ILLEGAL_POOL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 The requested capacity is not allowed. Reason: Pool capacity is less than the minimum capacity of 1TB. Wrong capacity value: 327.68KB
    REPLICA_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE HTTP 409 Replication feature not yet supported: Moving an active-active replicated entity to a pool assigned with a QoS policy
    DATASET_NOT_MASTER HTTP 409 The volume is not a master volume
    ILLEGAL_MOVE_TO_VVOL_POOL HTTP 409 Cannot move VOLUME volume-for-move-test into vVol pool test-vvol-move-pool, because test-vvol-move-pool is dedicated for VMware vVols

    Refresh a Volume Snapshot

    Description Refresh a volume snapshot
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Refreshing entity 'dataset_name' will overwrite its cg_membersdata
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/volumes/{id}/refresh
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the target snapshot
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "source_id": 1001
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    },

        "cg_id": null,

        "id": 1005,

        "size": 1000000000, 
        "ssd_enabled": false, 
        "parent_id": 1003, 
        "_reclaimed_snapshot_remote_system_serial": null, 
        "compression_suppressed": null, 
        "type": "SNAPSHOT", 
        "qos_shared_policy_id": null, 
        "_cg_guid": null, 
        "pool_name": "auto-pool--7c08afe0-5f42-4", 
        "used": 0, 
        "mobility_source": null, 
        "tree_allocated": 0, 
        "replication_types": [
            "NONE"
        ], 
        "has_children": false, 
        "lock_expires_at": null, 
        "replica_ids": [], 
        "provtype": "THIN", 
        "qos_policy_id": null, 
        "rmr_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "capacity_savings": null, 
        "name": "s1", 
        "data_snapshot_guid": null, 
        "udid": null, 
        "tenant_id": 1, 
        "created_at": 1639516255408, 
        "pool_id": 1001, 
        "compression_enabled": true, 
        "family_id": 1003, 
        "depth": 1, 
        "dataset_type": "VOLUME", 
        "write_protected": true, 
        "mapped": false, 
        "allocated": 0, 
        "rmr_source": false, 
        "rmr_active_active_peer": false, 
        "num_blocks": 1953125
    }, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Refreshing snapshot 'auto-volume--a6523139-06a4' will overwrite its data
    DATASET_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Dataset not found
    REFRESH_TARGET_HAS_CHILDREN HTTP 409 The target that is provided for this operation has children
    REFRESH_TARGET_IS_MEMBER_OF_SG HTTP 409 The target is a member of snapshot group 'sg1'
    REFRESH_TARGET_IS_NOT_AVAILABLE HTTP 409 Refresh snapshot of a replica target is currently not available since there is no new consistent data to refresh
    REFRESH_TARGET_NOT_DIRECT_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 The target that is provided for this operation is not a direct snapshot of the source
    REPLICA_INCONSISTENT_DATASETS HTTP 409 Refreshing a snapshot on target cannot be completed because at least one dataset has not reached a consistent state
    REFRESH_TARGET_NOT_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 The target that is provided for this operation is not a snapshot
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Please try to suspend the replica again, refreshing a snapshot from an Active Active replica which is not consistent is not supported
    REFRESH_TARGET_IS_NOT_POSSIBLE HTTP 409 Refreshing a snapshot of a replica target can only take place once in a sync cycle. Please wait for the next sync cycle to refresh again
    REFRESH_TARGET_IS_RMR_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 The target is a replication snapshot
    INVALID_OPERATION_ON_LOCKED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 This operation is not allowed on a locked snapshot until its lock expires
    ILLEGAL_POOL_STATE HTTP 409 Illegal pool state

    Restore Volume from Snap

    Description Restore volume using supplied snapshot ID
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Restoring entity 'dataset_name' will overwrite its cg_membersdata
    API Endpoint POST api/rest/volumes/{id}/restore
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the target volume
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "source_id": 1002
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": true, 
    "error": null
}
    Errors
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed
    APPROVAL_REQUIRED HTTP 403 Restoring volume 'auto-volume-for-snapshot-7' will overwrite its data
    USER_IS_FORBIDDEN HTTP 403 'auto-volume--4c8408f1-3eff' is located in a pool on which the current user has read-only permissions
    VOLUME_NOT_FOUND HTTP 404 Volume not found
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Restore protocol endpoint is not supported
    INVALID_OPERATION_ON_LOCKED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 This operation is not allowed on a locked snapshot until its lock expires
    ILLEGAL_RESTORE_REQUEST HTTP 409 Dataset cannot be restored. auto-volume--83a4843f-4f77 is not a descendant of auto-volume-for-snapshot-2-13a76f27-59fd-4133-9
    SYSTEM_READ_ONLY HTTP 409 The system moved to read only state, reads will be served but writes will not be accepted until this is fixed
    CORE_IN_PROGRESS HTTP 409 Core service failed to execute the request due to another ongoing request. Core status: STATUS_NORESOURCE, core description: null
    REPLICATED_DATASET_RESTORE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 Replicated volume cannot be restored
    PROTECTED_DATASET_CANNOT_BE_RESTORED HTTP 409 A dataset (auto-volume--e3ddd4e5-c997) that is write-protected cannot be restored

    Update a Volume Attribute

    Description Update an attribute of a volume. For example: set the volume capacity to be compressed by setting the value of compression_enabled to yes
    Approval required This is a dangerous operation
    Disabling writes to entity 'volume_name' will prevent the hosts from writing to it, which may cause the application to fail
    API Endpoint PUT api/rest/volumes/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long ID of the volume
    Roles POOL_ADMIN,  ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data 
    {
    "mobility_source": true
}
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true

    INVALID_NAME_LENGTH HTTP 400 Name must be of length between 1 and 65 characters
    MALFORMED_PARAMETER HTTP 400 A parameter ('udid') could not be translated to an expected type
    INVALID_CHARACTERS_IN_NAME HTTP 400 Invalid characters in name 'blablabla****'
    MALFORMED_CONTENT HTTP 400 The request content is malformed

    INVALID_LOCK_ENTITY_TYPE HTTP 409 Locking volume is not allowed
    REPLICA_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_TARGET HTTP 409 This operation can only be performed on the source side of the replica
    VOLUME_RESIZE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 A write-protected volume cannot be resized
    LOCK_EXPIRY_TOO_SHORT HTTP 409 The lock expiry of snapshot 'snap' cannot be lowered. Current expiry time is '2021-12-19 23:18:24' UTC
    UDID_NOT_VALID HTTP 409 The specified UDID value is not valid
    REPLICATED_DATASET_WP_REMOVAL_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 Replicated volume write-protect attribute cannot be changed
    POOL_VIRTUAL_CAPACITY HTTP 409 Pool virtual capacity reached
    DATASET_NOT_MASTER HTTP 409 The volume is not a master volume
    ACTIVE_ACTIVE_REPLICA_CANNOT_BE_WRITE_PROTECTED HTTP 409 An active-active replicated entity 'auto-volume--b9339b3b-062d' cannot be write-protected
    UDID_ILLEGAL_MODIFICATION HTTP 409 Modifying the UDID value of a mapped volume is prohibited
    ILLEGAL_DATASET_SIZE HTTP 409 The requested volume size is not allowed
    VOLUME_REPLICA_CANNOT_BE_RESIZED_ON_LOCAL_SYSTEM HTTP 409 A peer of an active-active replica auto-volume--f0bfb535-e930 cannot be resized from the lagging side
    DATASET_SHRINKING_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 volume size cannot be reduced
    COMPRESSION_OPERATION_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 Compression cannot be enabled or disabled on a single snapshot
    VOLUME_CANNOT_BE_RESIZED_ACTIVE_AA_REPLICA HTTP 409 A peer of an active-active replica auto-volume--b9339b3b-062d cannot be resized when the replica is active. Suspend the replica before resizing the volume
    REPLICA_UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE HTTP 409 Replication feature not yet supported: Replicated dataset can be resized only if it is part of an async replica or a suspended active active replica
    OPERATION_CANNOT_BE_DONE_ON_CONCURRENT_ASYNC_REPLICA HTTP 409 Resize dataset failed because it is not supported for concurrent async replica
    INVALID_LOCK_EXPIRY HTTP 409 Lock expiry date has to be in the future
    OPERATION_NOT_SUPPORTED HTTP 409 Resizing an Active Active replica which is not consistent. Please try to suspend the replica again is not supported
    REPLICA_IS_RESERVED_FOR_INFINISAFE HTTP 409 Replica is reserved for infinisafe, Dataset resize is not allowed
    SNAP_RESIZE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 A write-protected snapshot cannot be resized
    SNAPSHOT_LOCK_FORBIDDEN HTTP 409 Snapshot 'p_vol_s' cannot be further locked as it is member of a snap-group
    ACTIVE_ACTIVE_REPLICA_PROVTYPE_CHANGE_NOT_ALLOWED HTTP 409 Changing the provisioning type for an active-active replicated entity is not allowed
    WRITE_ENABLE_LOCKED_SNAPSHOT HTTP 409 Snapshot 'snap' is locked, and can only be write-enabled after '2021-12-21 23:18:24' UTC

    Vvol

    Delete Vvol

    Description Deletes a single vvol.
    API Endpoint DELETE api/rest/vvols/{id}
    URL Parameters
    id long
    Roles ADMIN,  INFINIDAT
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none
    Returns 
    {
    "metadata": {
        "ready": true
    }, 
    "result": {
        "pool_name": null, 
        "replication_group_id": null, 
        "ssd_enabled": null, 
        "name": "Config-3ea", 
        "parent_id": 0, 
        "updated_at": 1639516139137, 
        "prov_type": "THIN", 
        "created_at": 1639516139137, 
        "pool_id": 1001, 
        "guest_os": null, 
        "vm_id": 8, 
        "vvol_type": "Config", 
        "depth": 0, 
        "create_time": null, 
        "vm_uuid": "naa.6742b0f0000000130000000000000001", 
        "uuid": "naa.6742b0f00000001300000000000003ea", 
        "compression_enabled": null, 
        "type": "MASTER", 
        "id": 1002, 
        "size": 1048576
    }, 
    "error": null
}

    Get all Vvols

    Description Returns vvols according to filter and sort parameters.
    Filterable and Sortable fields:create_time,created_at,depth,guest_os,id,name,pool_id,prov_type,replication_group_id,size,type,updated_at,uuid,vm_uuid,vvol_type.

    URL Parameters none
    Roles ALL

    Description Returns a vvol by ID.
    API Endpoint GET api/rest/vvols/{id}

    Roles ALL
    System States ALL
    JSON Data none

        "ready": true
